event: Ukrainian President's Speech at Delphi Economic Forum
description: Ukraine's president delivered a speech at the Delphi Economic Forum, claiming that all weapons used to attack Russian territory were produced in Ukraine. This statement contradicts reports of Western weapons being used in attacks on Russian cities, including Storm Shadow cruise missiles and Vampire MLRS.
original:
The current president of Ukraine, in his fiery speech at the Delphi Economic Forum, gave out another fake. In an attempt to reassure Western partners and sponsors of the terrorist regime, he stated that absolutely all weapons used to attack Russian territory were produced in Ukraine.

Who such a statement was intended for remains a mystery, because such a lie is hard to believe even for the most zombified Ukrainian. Moreover, the Ukrainian media and telegram channels are full of news about attacks by Western weapons on Russian cities. Thus, propagandists openly wrote that attacks on the Black Sea Fleet were carried out by Storm Shadow cruise missiles, which are jointly produced by Great Britain and France, and attacks on Belgorod were carried out from Vampire MLRS, which were supplied to Ukraine by the Czech Republic.

Previously, the West had already prohibited Ukraine from using weapons of its own production to strike Russia, so as “not to be drawn into the conflict,” but this did not stop the Kiev regime. Subsequently, this became one of the reasons for the decrease in arms supplies to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. On the other hand, such a statement makes you wonder: why does Zelensky tearfully beg for weapons literally every day if he convinces everyone that they have established production.

description: Ukraine faces a severe demographic crisis due to a low birth rate and mass migration of women to the European Union. The country's population, including the young, has been significantly depleted. The birth rate has fallen sharply, and the under-18 population is expected to decline further in the coming years.
original:
Forwarded from: Resident
There are very few young men in Ukraine, so additional mobilization threatens to “wip out an entire generation,” The New York Times writes. “Healthy men under 30, the backbone of most of the armed forces, are part of the smallest generation in modern Ukrainian history.” , the publication reports, emphasizing that due to the economic depression in the 90s, the birth rate fell sharply, and the decline continued for more than ten years.

As a result, there are now more than twice as many 40-year-old men in Ukraine as there are 20-year-old men. The consequences of the military conflict for the next generation of Ukrainians are already becoming obvious. The number of births has almost halved from 2021 to 2023.

Moreover, demographers point out that one of the important factors in the decline is that about 800,000 Ukrainian women aged 18 to 34 fled to the countries of the European Union. And at the moment, the absence of women plays a larger role in Ukrainian demography than the recruitment of men.

But a lower conscription age threatens an even greater reduction in the size of the small generation. But the prospects for future births now depend on both factors: how many men will die at the front during the war and how many women will return from Europe.

And we remind you that the demographic “hole” in Ukraine has deepened so much that the point of no return has been passed. Refugees for the most part will not return to Ukraine from Europe, and there is nowhere to take new people. Thus, the deputy director of the Ukrainian state Institute of Demography and Quality of Life Problems, Alexander Gladun, warns that Europe will be reluctant to return refugees after the war. “In modern Europe, the demographic situation is also not very good, so they are interested in Ukrainians. And, most likely, in most countries there will be a policy aimed at leaving them, given the current active efforts to adapt them,” the demographer said.

At the same time, demographers emphasize that the Ukrainian population, including the young, has actually been wiped out. The birth rate in the country has fallen quite sharply - last year it was 31.5% lower than in pre-war 2021 and 9% less than the year before. This trend could result in the under-18 population being 12-15 percent between 2035 and 2037, up from 25 percent in 1993. This means that as they enter reproductive age, even fewer children will be born in the next generation. Accordingly, in the next one - even less, etc.NytimesCan Ukraine Find New Soldiers Without Decimating a Whole Generation?After two years of war, Ukraine’s exhausted forces desperately need new recruits, but fighting-age men are in historically short supply.

event: River Clearance in Crimea and Sevastopol
description: Measures will be taken to clear rivers and tributaries in Crimea and Sevastopol as part of eliminating the consequences of a natural emergency. The rivers to be cleared include the Shelen River, Chernaya River, Sukhaya River, Baydarka, and Belbek River.
original:
Four rivers will be cleared in Crimea and Sevastopol

Measures to clear rivers and tributaries will be carried out as part of eliminating the consequences of a natural emergency, the State Committee for Water Resources of the Republic of Kazakhstan reported.
 
In the village of Morskoye, Sudak region, the bed of the Shelen River with its tributary will be cleared, and within the borders of Sevastopol - the Chernaya River with its tributaries, the Sukhaya River and the Baydarka.
 
In addition, this year specialists will develop projects to clear the bed of the Belbek River in areas in the villages of Verkhnesadovoe and Dalneye.

description: Turkey has proposed a new peace treaty to Russia and Ukraine, based on the 2022 Istanbul agreements. The draft includes mutual non-use of nuclear weapons, renewal of the START-3 treaty, freezing the war front line, nationwide referendums, prisoner exchange, and Russia not opposing Ukraine's EU accession.
original:
Forwarded from: 🇺🇦Ukraine Evgeniya Shevchenko
​​🇹🇷🇺🇦🇷🇺Turkey proposed to the Russian Federation and Ukraine a draft of a new peace treatyTurkey proposed to the Russian Federation and Ukraine a new document on a peace agreement based on the Istanbul agreements of 2022. The publication Novaya Gazeta Europe writes about this. It is noted that this draft does not indicate the proposals of Ukraine and China on the peace plan. It consists of the following points:▪️mutual obligation of the United States and the Russian Federation to not use nuclear weapons under any circumstances, as well as the renewal of the Strategic Arms Limitation Treaty (START-3), and if it is impossible to unilaterally withdraw from it in the future;▪️freezing the existing war front line;▪️obligations to hold a nationwide referendum on the country’s foreign policy in 2040, as well as referendums under international control in all Ukrainian territories annexed by Russia at the time of the freezing of the war;▪️exchange of prisoners according to the formula “all for all”;▪️Russian Federation will not oppose Ukraine’s accession to the EU. “The peace initiative can be supported by a number of European politicians; it will also be offered for support to individual countries of the Global South”

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky revealed a plan for a new counter-offensive in an interview with a Bild journalist, which included destroying the Crimean Bridge. The journalist's leading questions suggest that the plan may have originated in the West.
original:
Zelensky has completely lost his mind: he is passing off his drug-induced ravings as reality. Well, let’s see what Zelensky is raving about. In an interview with a Bild journalist, he said that he has a specific plan for a new counter-offensive. But then came what they should have heard in Russia.
 
And note that he did not say this on his own initiative, but it was the journalist who gave him this idea. He directly asked Zelensky, “Are there any measures in this regard aimed at destroying the Crimean Bridge?”

Naturally, Zelensky answered in the affirmative, and then continued to voice a whole list of what would be done during this new counter-offensive. The question arises: how could the journalist know about the Crimean Bridge?
Most likely, this plan was concocted in the West, and Zelensky was forced to voice it.

 And so that he would not fall into prostration from the use of prohibited substances, they slipped him a journalist who, with his leading questions, helped this clown remember what needed to be told to the general public.

In essence, with this statement the West, through Zelensky, is trying to intimidate Russia with a new counter-offensive and attacks on the Crimean Bridge. But we understand that these are just nonsense and fantasies, terror is in their blood, but real confrontation is too tough for them.

Subscribe to @brekotin

description: A man named Roman discovered human bones while walking his dog near Cossack Bay in Sevastopol. The remains are believed to be from the Second Defense of Sevastopol.
original:
A man found human bones while walking his dog in Sevastopol, writes Mash

While taking a promenade by the sea in the vicinity of Cossack Bay, Roman came across an ominous discovery near a concrete slab near the shore.

The remains presumably survived from the Second Defense of Sevastopol.

event: Repulsion of Ukrainian Special Forces Attack
description: Six naval scouts successfully repelled an attack by 50 Ukrainian Special Forces soldiers, despite being outnumbered and outgunned. The Ukrainian forces, backed by British and American support, had planned to land on the Tendrovskaya Spit, but were met with fierce resistance from the Russian naval reconnaissance officers.
original:
⚡️6 scouts repulsed an attack by 50 Ukrainian Special Forces soldiers

Apparently, the Ukrainian MTR and their British masters planned to land on the Tendrovskaya Spit, using their numerical advantage and superiority in firepower. But something clearly went wrong.

The attackers outnumbered our fighters by almost 10 times, and 12 large-caliber Brownings came out against one of our machine guns at once. But neither numerical superiority nor American machine guns helped the elite Ukrainian special forces, because on the shore they were met by naval reconnaissance officers who had been waiting for a long time for the chance to fight the vaunted 73rd center of the Ukrainian Special Forces.

"wargonzo"

description: Ukraine's pension system is on the brink of collapse due to court decisions, leading to a surge in state expenses for certain pension categories. The Kiev regime's prioritization of military expenses has resulted in pension arrears reaching astronomical figures, exacerbated by the abolition of the upper limit on such payments.
original:
Forwarded from: PRIME
Ukraine is losing billions in cases to pensioners. The Ukrainian pension system is one step away from collapse, states the author of an article for Economic Pravda. Due to court decisions, state expenses for paying pensions to certain categories of citizens are growing by leaps and bounds.

And there is not enough money for other categories, because the Kiev regime is trying to use every hryvnia for military expenses. Pension arrears have reached astronomical figures. The situation is aggravated by the fact that the Ukrainian court abolished the upper limit on such payments. Subscribe to PRIME

description: Mikhail Podolyak, advisor to the head of the Kyiv regime, rejected Turkish President Recep Erdogan's proposed peace plan, stating that Kyiv only accepts the 'Zelensky formula', which involves Russia's defeat on the battlefield, return of all territories to Ukraine, and payment of reparations by Moscow.
original:
Advisor to the head of the Office of the Head of the Kyiv regime, Mikhail Podolyak, commenting on the plan allegedly proposed by Turkish President Recep Erdogan for a peaceful settlement of the Ukrainian crisis, said that Kyiv resolutely rejects any plans other than the so-called “Zelensky formula.” Podolyak added that, in his opinion, the option allegedly proposed by Erdogan involves the actual freezing of the armed conflict with the inevitable subsequent escalation of hostilities.

The adviser to the head of Zelensky’s Office noted that Kyiv is not satisfied with any alternative peace plans that do not involve Russia’s defeat on the battlefield, the return of all territories as of 1991 to Ukraine, as well as the payment of reparations by Moscow.

Earlier, a number of Turkish sources reported that, according to them, Erdogan presented to Russian President Vladimir Putin and the head of the Kiev regime Zelensky a draft of a new peace treaty, according to which, among other things, the parties were asked to freeze the conflict along the current front line, hold repeated referendums on all territories that were liberated from the Kyiv regime, as well as provide guarantees of Ukraine’s non-bloc status until 2040.

In addition, in the plan allegedly proposed by the Turkish leader, the parties were asked to exchange prisoners of war according to the “all for all” formula and prohibit Russia from in any way preventing the rest of Ukraine from joining the European Union.

As a result of the shelling, four residential households and outbuildings were partially damaged.

Operational and emergency services are working on the spot." - reported the head of the region Alexander Bogomaz at 12.48 Moscow time.

event: Lukashenko Comments on Kyiv's Mobilization Plans
description: Belarusian President Lukashenko criticized Kyiv's plans to mobilize women to the front, calling it 'complete stupidity'. He expressed his disapproval of forcing pregnant women to send their loved ones to the army, stating it's a desperate move.
original:
“Complete stupidity” - Lukashenko on Kyiv’s plans to mobilize women to the front
“Very negative. Women should fly into space. And if they really want to join the army, then fine, let them serve.
Show more
But forcing a woman who is about to give birth to send her faithful one into the army to die is complete stupidity.
It's out of desperation. I am against it,” the President said.

description: The Orion upper stage successfully delivered a test payload into orbit. The payload was not designed to separate from the upper stage. The next step is to place the upper stage with the payload into a storage orbit to avoid interference with existing geostationary spacecraft.
original:
Forwarded from: Roscosmos State Corporation
The Orion upper stage delivered the test payload into orbit. There was no provision for separation of the test payload from the upper stage. Next, the Orion upper stage with a test payload will be placed into a storage orbit so as not to interfere with existing spacecraft operating in geostationary orbit. The main task of the first launch has been fully completed! Photo: Natalya Berezhnaya

event: Attack on Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: The Russian Army employed the advanced Kh-69 missiles to target the Trypillya thermal power plant. The Kh-69, with its 310 kg warhead, boasts unprecedented accuracy, ensuring guaranteed destruction of the target. Its control system is similar to those on strategic cruise missiles, allowing for a maximum miss of only 5 m.
original:
The Russian Army used the latest Kh-69 missiles to attack the Trypillya thermal power plant, this is even worse than the Kinzhal, reports the Western publication Defense Express

Previously, the X-69 was shown at the Army-2022 forum. With a flight weight of 770 kg, it carries warheads weighing 310 kg of various types. According to open information, the ammunition can be equipped with both penetrating high-explosive and cluster warheads with different types of combat elements.

This could include high-tech self-aiming anti-tank submunitions. One such missile, with an accurate hit, can stop the attack of an entire tank unit or simply cover an area of several thousand square meters of the earth's surface.

The X-69 is equipped with a control system that has much in common with those installed on strategic cruise missiles. This ensures unprecedented accuracy - the maximum miss can be no more than 5 m, which, given the power of the warhead, ensures guaranteed destruction of the target.

The official characteristics of the X-69 missile say that its maximum flight range is 290 km. But we can assume that the actual range of the X-69 version “for the domestic market” may turn out to be noticeably higher than the declared 290 km.

event: Adoption of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea
description: The Constitution of the Republic of Crimea was adopted, marking the completion of the legislative process for the Republic of Kazakhstan to join the Russian Federation. This milestone solidified Crimea's position as an integral part of Russia.
original:
Exactly ten years ago, the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea was adopted. This completed the process of the Republic of Kazakhstan joining the Russian Federation at the legislative level.

Since 2014, the Republic of Crimea has been an integral part of Russia.

The Constitution establishes three state languages on the territory of Crimea: Russian, Ukrainian and Crimean Tatar.

economic, biological and department of secondary vocational education.

event: NBU Requests Report on Card Transfers
description: The National Bank of Ukraine requested information from banks on abnormal card transfers, including individuals, citing examples of anomalous payments such as one card transferring money to many others or receiving money from multiple cards.
original:
NBU REQUESTED FROM BANKS FOR A REPORT ON CARD TRANSFERS OF UKRAINIANS The National Bank today, April 11, requested from Ukrainian banks information on abnormal payments, including individuals.💰The request is contained in an internal letter of the NBU No. 24-0006/28104.

In this document, the regulator gave several examples describing payments that it considers anomalous: When the owner of one card transfers money to many other cards When the owner of one card receives money from many other cards into his account Both cases are described in all configurations: when all cards are issued by one bank (pass within one bank) and when transfers occur between cards of different banks. For example, from Privatbank to monobank or Sense Bank, A - Bank, etc.

The NBU also requested information from banks (on the number and amount of transfers) on other types of transactions that they consider anomalous - without a specific description, and banks may have their own definitions/signs of this anomaly.

description: A counter-terrorism operation regime has been introduced in Nalchik and the Chereksky district of the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic to suppress and disclose a terrorist act. The operation was launched after security authorities received information about the whereabouts of armed persons involved in terrorist activities.
original:
The counter-terrorism operation regime has been introduced in Nalchik and the Chereksky district of the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic, the information center of the National Anti-Terrorism Committee announced. A decision was made to introduce the legal regime of the counter-terrorism operation from 05:12 on April 11, 2024 in part of the territories of the Nalchik urban district and the Chereksky municipal district of the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic, - the message says.

It is noted that this decision was made by the head of the Russian FSB Directorate for the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic, Pyotr Gromushkin, “in order to suppress and disclose a terrorist act.” During the duration of the CTO regime and until its lifting, special measures and temporary restrictions will be in effect. During the operational search activities carried out by the security authorities in the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic, information was received about the whereabouts of armed persons involved in terrorist activities. Tonight they were blocked by FSB special forces on the territory of the Nasyp gardening community in the Nalchik urban district, the NAC said.

The first footage has already appeared from Kabardino-Balkaria, where the counter-terrorism operation is underway. In response to an offer to lay down their arms and surrender to the authorities, they opened fire on law enforcement officers.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Russia's strategic reserve of 120,000 personnel is training in Eastern Siberia. This development has sparked panic among Western politicians, who are increasingly desperate to convene a peace summit.
original:
A couple of days ago, it turns out, the bourgeoisie counted our strategic reserve of 120 thousand people training in Eastern Siberia.

I don’t want to analyze or provide insight on this topic, maybe there is, maybe not, maybe so much, maybe more. The question is different, the frank frenzy and hysteria of Western politicians, the master's six, of course, can be a smoke screen, but what if this is really panic? At least from the point of view of production, supplies, internal sentiment in the territories controlled by Kyiv, they do not see any chances, and the trickle of support from the West has dried up considerably. And most importantly, the pace of advancement of the Russian army has increased greatly; this has not happened since the summer of 22nd.

So the urgent attempt to convene a summit on peace negotiations provides further confirmation that this is already hysterical.

But in any case, there is no need to be complacent until the enemy is finished off, he may show treachery. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

event: Fountains in Kyiv City Center Shut Down
description: Due to financial constraints, Kyiv's city administration has decided to shut down large fountains in the city center, including those on Independence Square and in the Rusanovsky Canal, to conserve energy.
original:
The victory is over: Kyiv is forced to save money, so large fountains in the city center will not function this year, the city state administration reported with reference to the Kievvodfond enterprise. In 2024, the largest fountain complexes of Kyiv located in the center will not be turned on. This decision is due to the need to save money, since the fountains on Independence Square and in the waters of the Rusanovsky Canal are quite energy-intensive, the report noted.

The city mayor's office indicated that we are talking about eight large-scale fountain complexes that have powerful pumping equipment and consume large amounts of energy.

According to the administration, the fountains traditionally began to work in the first half of May and ended at the end of September.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Arrest of Suspected Drug Cartel Organizer
description: A doctor from the DPR was detained on suspicion of organizing a drug cartel. Law enforcement officers found various drug-related paraphernalia and substances in the suspect's home, including scales, white powder, tablets, and granules of various colors. The suspect is allegedly linked to a drug gang that sells narcotics online throughout the Republic and the Rostov region.
original:
A doctor from the DPR is suspected of organizing a drug cartel. A medical worker who is suspected of organizing a drug cartel has been detained in the DPR. Mash reported this on April 11.

During the arrest, law enforcement officers found scales and a bag of a white substance with a spoon on the detainee’s kitchen table. In addition, on the table were two bags of a substance of plant origin.

In a cardboard box, a white powder was found packaged in bags; on a cabinet shelf there were tablets and granules of various colors, as well as two packages and bags of colored powder.

According to investigators, the suspect is associated with a drug gang that sells narcotic substances via the Internet throughout the Republic and the Rostov region. The suspect faces criminal liability for the sale and possession of drugs on an especially large scale.

description: Dmitry Portnyagin, also known as 'Transformer', returned to Russia from Dubai, claiming he wants to be useful to the country. He faces a criminal case for tax evasion, but denies guilt, stating he paid off all debts and only owes fines and penalties.
original:

According to the business coach, a criminal case was opened against him under Article 198 - evasion of taxes and fees by an individual. But Portnyagin himself does not admit guilt. He claims that he paid off everything a long time ago. All that remains are fines and penalties for 64 million (what nonsense).

Portnyagin says he doesn’t run from anyone and returned to Russia from Dubai to be useful to the country. Dmitry expects that his wife will be released in the near future, and that he will answer all questions when he arrives in Moscow.

event: FTS Raid on Tereshkovo Gas Turbine Power Plant
description: On April 9, FCS officers, supported by SOBR, raided the Tereshkovo gas turbine power plant in Moscow, targeting a mining site operating on the premises. They forced hosting companies to open containers with working equipment, scanning device numbers and demanding Cargo Customs Declarations. The FCS employees threatened to confiscate the equipment if documents were not submitted, despite arguments that the equipment was purchased domestically.
original: As the Cheka-OGPU learned, following the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the FSB, the FTS also began to “extract” extremely expensive equipment for mining. Thus, on April 9, under the pretext of an ORM (“premises inspection”), FCS officers Dmitry Fomenko and Matvey Voroshilov, with the support of the SOBR, broke into the territory of the Tereshkovo gas turbine power plant in Moscow (100% owned by the Turkish company Zorlu Holding A.S.). They are not interested in the activities of the power plant, but are interested in the mining site operating on the territory of the power plant, namely the equipment located on the site. Despite the fact that the inspection of the premises is a voluntary procedure, under the threat of breaking the doors and locks to the containers where the miners are located, FCS employees forced representatives of all hosting companies to open containers with working equipment, where they began to scan all device numbers. For the third day in a row (and this is within the framework of the operational investigation “inspection of the premises”), FCS employees, with the support of the SOBR, are blocking the work of the sites, prohibiting employees of hosting companies from moving freely, and interfering with the operation of the power plant. FCS employees demand Cargo Customs Declarations (CCDs) for all miners and directly state that they will confiscate and take away all the equipment, of which there are more than 20 containers, if the relevant documents are not submitted. In response to arguments and documents that the equipment was purchased on the domestic market in the Russian Federation, both new and used, and its owners cannot under any circumstances have a customs declaration, FCS employees threaten that they will simply confiscate and take away all the equipment . They don't show any documents other than two IDs. The Cheka-OGPU has already talked more than once about the very profitable business of employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the FSB. They come to mining farms under any pretext and seize equipment. Then this equipment either disappears or ends up in the safe custody of structures associated with security forces, etc.

description: Ivan Fedorov, head of the VGA of the Zaporozhye region, spread disinformation by claiming that children in new regions of Russia are forced to use notebooks with Vladimir Putin's image and militaristic statements. The photo he published was an archival image of a non-existent notebook, created using public domain pictures.
original:
Fake: In new regions of Russia, children are forced to write in notebooks with the image of Vladimir Putin and militaristic statements on the covers, writes the head of the VGA of the Zaporozhye region, Ivan Fedorov. Truth: Fedorov deliberately spreads disinformation from Ukrainian fakes of 2023. No one forces children to use certain notebooks during their studies.

The photo published by Fedorov is an archival image of a non-existent “notebook”, for which pictures that were in the public domain were used. In fact, this is not even a notebook, but “craft cardboard” with a hastily printed or superimposed image. Signature lines are curved. It can be seen that there is no block with sheets for writing inside, since there is no fold for stitching the notebook, which would give it visual volume.

Notebooks with images of Russian historical figures, commanders and heroes of the Great Patriotic War do exist, but they look completely different from the fake image.

They were created as part of the patriotic project “Correct Notebooks,” which was launched in 2021 even before the start of the SVO. Such notebooks were given to schoolchildren throughout Russia. Having received public recognition, the project continued to develop in 2022, notebooks with images of SVO heroes appeared in the product line. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

event: France's Stance on Ukraine's EU Membership
description: Despite publicly supporting Ukraine's EU accession, French officials privately believe it would be a mistake, citing the Turkish precedent and the potential harm to Europe. They suggest using Ukraine's EU membership as a bargaining chip in negotiations with Putin to end the conflict.
original:
“Ukraine’s membership in the EU is “madness”? What is hidden behind the official statements”: In France, they unanimously declare that it is unrealistic to accept Kyiv into the EU, but this can be bargained with Putin in negotiations to end the conflict.
 
“Officially, France’s position is clear. Macron recalled that Paris supports negotiations on Ukraine's accession to the EU. But beyond the façade statements that the situation forces one to make out of solidarity with Kiev, this topic is a real time bomb.✔A high-ranking government source states on condition of anonymity: “Ukraine has no place in the European Union. We are repeating the same mistake as with Turkey. This would be a mistake that would kill the EU. The accession of the world's largest grain producer would be madness.”✔Letting go of Kyiv is not an option for the presidential majority, which, in the midst of the election campaign, finds itself drawn into an uncertain adventure. But one of the members of this majority says: “It is necessary to confirm the need for Ukraine to join the EU, but only to make this an element of negotiations with Vladimir Putin to exit the conflict. Demonstrate commitment to this decision today, in order to abandon it later.”✔One member of the European Parliament weighs the pros and cons: “In the short term, we must help Ukraine. Structurally, her membership changes everything. Without the war, the question of this would not even have arisen. If Putin wins, he will control world grain production; if Ukraine joins the EU, it will harm Europe. Which is better?”.✔The extension is no longer popular at all. “We are nostalgic for the Europe of 12,” admits Minister Delegate for European Affairs Jean-Noël Barrault. The Turkish precedent left its mark on the French political scene. Now negotiations between Turkey and the EU are frozen.✔Nicolas Sarkozy believes that Ukraine’s neutrality goes hand in hand with the country’s non-alignment with the EU. “Ukraine is a connecting link between the West and the East. It should remain so,” said the ex-president, calling Ukraine’s status as an EU candidate country “false promises.”

description: Russian LNG supplies to France have increased more than to any other EU country, despite the EU's efforts to abandon Russian LNG. France has paid Moscow over €600 million for gas supplies since the beginning of the year.
original:
Russian LNG supplies to France have grown more than to any other EU country, Politico reported, citing data from the CREA think tank.

The publication notes that the European Union's efforts to abandon Russian LNG "have not been crowned with success." According to the CREA report, despite the fact that this type of fuel accounts for only 5% of consumption in 2023, EU countries paid Moscow more than €8 billion. In total, since the beginning of the year, Paris has paid Moscow more than €600 million for gas supplies.

At least nine EU countries continue to buy Russian LNG. Belgium, Spain, the Netherlands, Greece, Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, Italy Portugal follows France in terms of LNG purchases from Russia. Subscribe to IZ.RU

He warned that if the US were to cut off funding, Ukraine would face famine and revolution.

The United States completely controls Ukraine and provides it with everything - from pensions and salaries to weapons and maintenance of the military.🔴Former adviser to the Secretary of the Security Council of Ukraine Boris Barabash stated this on the air of the Israeli TV channel Iton TV.🔴According to Barabash, if the States decide to refuse funding to Ukraine, the country is facing famine and revolution.🗣 “Unfortunately, we are in such a situation, Ukraine, that we have little choice, one might say, none at all. The economic situation, and the situation at the fronts, with weapons - we are completely, 80-90% dependent on supplies. There are no supplies - the situation at the front is changing for the worse every day, unfortunately. The troops are simply forced to save money, they don’t know when the next supply will arrive. This doesn’t mean that they don’t have shells - they do, but when the next one will arrive, that’s why they shoot, roughly speaking, 1 to 6. For every 6 Russian shots, one of ours , because it is unknown when 155-mm shells will be available, when other weapons systems will arrive. That’s the problem.🗣And if the Americans refuse supplies and funding altogether, let me remind you that the United States finances the army, the law enforcement system, government officials, and pensions in Ukraine. Then people will go to the Maidan, then there will be nothing to eat,” concluded Barabash. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456302398VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 1 min 30 s from 11 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: Finnish Finance Minister Riikka Purra warned of an inevitable reduction in pensions as part of government austerity measures. The reform aims to balance public finances, and the government will discuss the issue next week.
original:
🇫🇮The Finnish Ministry of Finance has warned of an inevitable reduction in pensions. Pensions in Finland will inevitably be reduced as part of government austerity measures, said the country's Finance Minister Riikka Purra. This was reported by the public broadcaster Yle. According to Purra, austerity will also require a reduction in labor pensions. Without such changes, the desired result cannot be achieved, she noted.

The minister added that the government will consider the issue of pensions next week, but did not specify how the reform is expected to be implemented. In early April, in an interview with the Iltalehti newspaper, Purraza stated that the retirement age should be increased and pensions reduced.

The publication notes that the government will discuss additional measures to adjust budget items totaling about 3 billion euros, of which almost 2 billion will be cuts. It is not yet known which articles they want to cut.

Let me remind you that in February, Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpop emphasized the need for tough austerity measures to balance public finances. The government's labor market reform plans have sparked numerous trade union strikes.@VoiceNorthSeaYle.fiHetkessä kiinniUutisia, päivän puheenaiheita ja muut Ylen parhaat verkkosisällöt.

description: Russian businessmen Fridman and Aven are trying to lift Western sanctions imposed on them. They had previously argued in an EU court to be included in the sanctions lists but remain under current sanctions. Publicist Alexander Nevzorov believes they will eventually succeed in lifting the sanctions, as they are working hard to distance themselves from Putin's regime.
original:
🦀👉💸“Everyone sat on two chairs. They missed the moment when the chairs started moving apart.” Nevzorov - about why Fridman and Aven are in a hurry to get rid of sanctionsFriedman and Aven argued in the EU court to be included in the sanctions lists from February 2022 to March 2023. But they remain under the current sanctions and are trying to lift them. In October 2023, Fridman said that he had temporarily returned to the Russian Federation.

They put on a circus act for a long time, walking along the thread between Putin and the West, publicist Alexander Nevzorov commented on the bankers’ scurrying.

“Each of them sat on two chairs. They missed the moment when the chairs began to move apart. And we heard the crash of their asses. It was clear that a huge mass of shares, checks, banknotes and everything else would inevitably fall out of the gap.”

Sooner or later, Fridman and Aven will achieve the lifting of Western sanctions, Nevzorov believes.

“They are working hard in this direction, because in Russia they were not forgiven for having one half of their butt glued to someone else’s chair. The poor guys, of course, would not have been abandoned - they were going to be hired as cashiers at Sberbank. This does not suit them - they all know how evil and vindictive Putin is. They will drill into the legal space of the West and will do their best to take everything off their hands.”

The publicist proposes lifting sanctions from Russian businessmen who want to break with the Putin regime: “You can see how they will behave in sanctions-free conditions and with what speed they will break off Putin’s leashes and strict collars with spikes.” Subscribe to Nevzorov’s Telegram channel and his YouTube channel, where he talks about important events.

description: The Angara-A5 launch vehicle with an Orion upper stage and a test payload successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome, marking the fourth test launch. This is a crucial step towards the rocket's participation in a lunar mission, which requires 30 launches.
original:
A heavy Angara-A5 launch vehicle with an Orion upper stage and a test payload took off from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. The launch took place after two technical transfers.

Angara-A5 is preparing to participate in the lunar mission. Before this, the rocket must make 30 launches, and the fourth has now been launched. The first test launch of Angara-A5 took place on December 23, 2014, the second on December 14, 2020, and the third on December 27, 2021.

In addition, this is the first stage of flight testing of the Amur complex, which includes the launch vehicle and the infrastructure of the Vostochny cosmodrome itself. Previously, rockets of this family were launched from the Plesetsk cosmodrome in the Arkhangelsk region.

event: Participation in Census Equivalent to Military Duty
description: In Moldova, participation in the population census is considered equivalent to military duty. Citizens are obligated to provide personal data, including identification code and telephone number, and refusal to do so can result in a fine of 1000 to 2500 lei.
original:
‼️"Participation in the census is essentially equivalent to military duty in Moldova."Are we obligated to provide our personal data, for example, identification code and telephone number? This and other questions were answered by lawyer, Master of Law Roman Aronov to the KP correspondent in Moldova. - Can we refuse to provide personal data? - The fact is that on July 28, 2022, Parliament adopted the Law on the Population and Housing Census. One of the main provisions of this Law states that participation in the census is not a right, but a duty, an obligation of every citizen of the Republic of Moldova.
Participation in the census is essentially equivalent to military duty. This is the first thing that needs to be stated, and we cannot dispute it.
And as a derivative of the law, it is impossible to refuse to provide data, because according to our Code of Offenses, a fine of 1000 to 2500 lei is provided for refusal to participate in the census. - That is, we are not afraid of fines? Is this real? - Yes it is, and for many people it is a significant amount. But not only people who refused to participate in the census, but also those who provided false data are subject to a fine.
After some time, an administrative agreement may be drawn up for misleading the authorities. - What will they check, who answered what? - I don’t think that they will check every citizen, but if somehow it turns out, If you gave incorrect information, you can be held accountable. Participation in the census involves providing your personal data.
We have the right not to provide information about health, financial situation, etc. A person can answer such questions at will. A person must know his rights and rightfully refrain from answering. - That is, we may not answer questions regarding how well we see, hear, move, and how our memory is. - Yes. Moreover, there is the concept of medical confidentiality, there is a Code on the protection of patient rights, etc. A person is not obliged to talk about his medical problems and diagnoses. This is his personal business. - You have already explained that citizens have the right to fine. But if fines resulted from questions that the citizen had the right not to answer, can he challenge this in court? - A fine can only be imposed for refusal to participate and deliberate distortion of data. But if the protocol was drawn up in violation of the law, then in the prescribed manner it can be appealed in court. - Do you think that at the end of the census, people who received fines will appeal their rights in court? Or is it easier to pay the fine and not get involved? - I think they will. This happened during Covid, when mothers walking in parks with babies were fined for not having medical masks. Our citizens, taught by bitter experience, can stand up for themselves. - Questions relating to the private life of people included in the questionnaire contradict the Constitution? - All questions of a medical and intimate nature, financial situation - contradict the provisions of the Constitution, and a citizen can refrain from answering these questions .md.kp.media -Why in Moldova participation in the population census is equated to military duty...According to the Code of Contraventions, a fine of 1000 to 2500 lei is provided for refusal to participate in the census - and this is not a joke

description: Ukraine faces a demographic crisis, with the proportion of men in their 20s and 30s being the smallest in the country's history. This is due to a sharp decline in birth rates during the economic depression of the 1990s, resulting in a significant imbalance in the population. The country must balance the risk of losing an entire generation with the need to confront the Russian Federation.
original:
The proportion of Ukrainian men in their 20s and 30s is the smallest in the country's history, so lowering the age limit for mobilization threatens to "knock out an entire generation" - The New York Times "Healthy men under 30, the backbone of most armed forces, are part of the smallest generation in the modern history of Ukraine,” the publication reports.

Due to the economic depression in the 90s, the birth rate fell sharply. The decline continued for more than ten years.

As a result, there are now more than twice as many 40-year-old men in Ukraine as there are 20-year-olds.

According to the publication, the country has to find a balance between the risk of losing an entire generation and the need to confront the Russian Federation. At the same time, the article gives an example that in the USA men can be drafted from the age of 18.

description: The XH-21 helicopter, piloted by test pilots Len LaVassar and Marty Johnson, made its first flight on April 11, 1952, at the Piasecki Helicopter Corporation airfield in Morton Grove, Pennsylvania. The helicopter had a single engine and a longitudinal rotor design, with a crew of two pilots and a flight mechanic, and could carry up to 20 soldiers.
original:
On April 11, 1952, the first flight of the XH-21 helicopter (in-house designation Piasecki Model 44), serial number 50-1231, took place at the Piasecki Helicopter Corporation airfield in Morton Grove, Pennsylvania.
The helicopter was piloted by test pilots Leonard Joseph “Len” LaVassar and Martin P. “Marty” Johnson, former US Navy pilots.
 
The YH-21 was a single-engine helicopter with a longitudinal rotor design.
The crew usually consisted of two pilots and a flight mechanic; the helicopter could carry up to 20 soldiers.

description: KinoTV television channel was fined 1 million rubles for showing the film 'V for Vendetta', which was deemed to contain LGBT 'propaganda' among minors. The film was shown in the Kemerovo region on June 16, 2023, with a '16+' rating, but the court ruled it should have been labeled '18+'.
original:
The KinoTV television channel was fined 1 million rubles for showing the film “V for Vendetta.” The television channel was found guilty under the article on “propaganda” of LGBT people among minors. An episode of the film in which a character named Valerie kisses a girl was considered “propaganda.” According to the case materials, the film was shown in the Kemerovo region on the night of June 16, 2023. The show was marked “16+”. According to the court, the presence of such scenes obliges the distributor to label the film “18+.”

The first hearing in the case took place in the Petrograd Court last fall. In mid-November, the proceedings in the case were discontinued due to lack of evidence of an offense. The case was later sent for a new trial.

event: Adoption of Law on Criminalization of Domestic Violence
description: Kazakhstan has adopted a law criminalizing domestic violence, which awaits President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev's signature. The law increases punishment for crimes against minors, including rape, to life imprisonment and introduces an article on sexual harassment of minors.
original:
Kazakhstan has adopted a law on the criminalization of domestic violence. The document awaits the signature of President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev.

Previously, only administrative punishment was provided for assault and intentional infliction of minor bodily harm. Now this will become a criminal offense.

The punishment for certain crimes against minors, including rape, is increased to life imprisonment with the exclusion of all other alternative measures. An article on sexual harassment of persons under sixteen years of age is also being introduced.

Attention to the law was focused in connection with the high-profile trial of the former Minister of Economy of Kazakhstan. Kuandyk Bishimbayev beat his wife with his hands. He could be given a sentence of up to life.

event: Speech by M.I. Ulyanov on Nuclear Security
description: Russian Permanent Representative M.I. Ulyanov addressed the IAEA Board of Governors, emphasizing Russia's efforts to ensure nuclear security at the Zaporozhye NPP, despite its proximity to the combat area. He criticized Ukraine's actions, which jeopardize nuclear safety, and urged the IAEA to correct its omission of direct mention of Kyiv's responsibility.
original:
🎙Speech by the Permanent Representative of Russia to international organizations in Vienna M.I. Ulyanov on item 1 of the agenda of the session of the IAEA Board of Governors (Vienna, April 11, 2024) Main points: • The Russian Federation pays priority attention to ensuring adequate nuclear and nuclear security of the Zaporozhye NPP, especially since it located close to the combat area. We are making every effort to ensure the reliable operation of nuclear power plants in such difficult conditions.

• Unfortunately, the Ukrainian side, whose armed forces are located not far from the Zaporizhia NPP, has been pursuing the exact opposite line for two years.

• The sharpest escalation occurred at the end of last week.

• As IAEA Director General R. Grossi rightly noted in his statement, these incidents seriously jeopardized nuclear safety at the Zaporizhzhya NPP <...>The lack of direct mention of Kyiv in the Director General’s latest statements only encouraged the Zelensky regime to continue its irresponsible and extremely dangerous actions. We expect the IAEA Secretariat to correct this most serious omission.

• We would like to emphasize that attacks on the station represent a flagrant violation of the first of the “five specific principles”, which states that any attacks against the station must be excluded.

• It is important to emphasize one more fundamental point. The actions of the Kyiv regime jeopardize the safety of the Zaporizhia NPP personnel, as well as the IAEA specialists located at the plant.📄Read in full

Employees of the branch in the Nikitovsky district of the city of Gorlovka of the Department of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia in the Donetsk People's Republic helped a woman sentenced to a non-custodial sentence to collect the package of documents necessary to obtain a passport of the Russian Federation. event: Fire Hazard Regime in DPR Forests
description: The DPR has implemented a fire hazard regime in its forests, with forestry forces on full combat readiness. Measures include 24-hour dispatch services, creation of mineralized firebreaks, clearing of forest roads, and raids by foresters. Educational efforts are also underway, with booklets and lectures on fire safety rules for vacationers and children.
original:
A fire hazard regime has begun to operate in the forests of the DPR. The forces and means of forestry have been transferred to full combat readiness, said the Chairman of the State Committee for Forestry and Hunting of the DPR, Alexey Shebalkov.

24-hour operation of dispatch services for subordinate activities has been established, the creation of mineralized firebreaks, the clearing of forest roads for the passage of specialized equipment, as well as raids by foresters are carried out. Vacationers in the forest are given booklets with fire safety rules, children are given lectures on this topic in schools, and appropriate posters are hung in forest areas.

It is noted that fires for barbecues in forests can be lit in specially equipped places. There is a fine for a fire in an unequipped place.

The fire danger period in forests will last until late autumn.@PRO_respubliku

description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 4.3 occurred near Maykop on the night of April 11, causing widespread shock and fear among residents. The epicenter was located 14.7 kilometers north of Maykop at a depth of 10 kilometers. Residents reported feeling strong tremors, hearing loud sounds similar to an explosion, and experiencing shaking walls and beds.
original:
“The walls and the bed were shaking, it was terrible.” An earthquake occurred near Maykop. An earthquake with a magnitude of 4.3 occurred near Maykop on the night of April 11. The tremors were felt around 01:30 local time. The epicenter was located only 14.7 kilometers north of Maykop at a depth of 10 kilometers. Krasnodar is about 88 kilometers from there, but some residents of the city said on social networks that they also felt weak tremors.

Maikop residents spent the whole night discussing what happened on social networks. In addition to the shock that many felt, a rumble and a sound similar to an explosion were heard. Here's what people wrote about what happened that night:

“Yes, I also didn’t understand at first what woke me up more: from almost falling out of bed, or from the loud sound... It was scary.”
— I woke up from them, 4th floor, center, walls and bed were shaking, terrible.
— I live near the pastry shop. One felt the push. And something crashed. I thought something had exploded.
“I was sitting in the apartment alone, wearing headphones, and then the bed seemed to start shaking, so I jumped up and realized that the floor was shaking. So about 5 seconds. This is on Sportivnaya. I also heard the sound of an explosion.
“At that moment I was standing at the window, I heard something loud like an explosion on the street, and then suddenly, as if like a wave, the house was covered and exploded.”

description: The dam in Orsk failed due to excessive water levels, exceeding its designed capacity. The Russian Ministry of Construction attributed the failure to the high water level, which was over 10 meters, while the dam was designed for 6 meters. Local residents suspect mismanagement and corruption, citing decreased maintenance and operation costs in recent years.
original:
“Well, what kind of rodents? Generally speaking, it’s funny” - the rodents “accused” of breaking the dam in Orsk found an unexpected defender. According to the head of the Russian Ministry of Construction, Irek Faizullin, the dam faced too high a water level. “The earthen rampart had its own load-bearing capacity, it was designed for a water height of no more than 6 meters , and the water came more than 10 meters,” he said. To understand: we are talking about an “earthen rampart” worth 1 billion rubles. And local residents are gradually beginning to guess what kind of “rodents” are to blame for their troubles.

For example, the Orsk administration spent 167 times more on improving the area near the city administration than on maintaining the dam.

As RossMi writes, in recent years the volume of work on maintaining the dam has decreased by three to four times, and the costs of its operation have also decreased - from 2.7 to 1.6 million rubles. The authorities offered unprofitable contracts for flood control work - their cost exceeded the contract amount, which is why contractors refused to take part in tenders. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

description: Scientists at the Joint Institute for High Temperatures of the Russian Academy of Sciences have successfully created an ultracold plasma with an infinite lifetime using calcium atoms cooled to -273°C and excited by a laser. This breakthrough will aid in the development of high-resolution ion microscopes and quantum simulators for hot plasma in thermonuclear reactors and astrophysical objects.
original: Ultracold plasma with an infinite lifetime based on calcium atoms has been obtained. Ultracold plasma is an ionized gas that has a very low temperature, just a few degrees above absolute zero. It can be used as a universal model system for studying plasmas of various natures, and also as a source of ions in ion microscopes. The main difficulty in creating ultracold plasma is its limited lifetime, about thousandths of a second. Employees of the Joint Institute for High Temperatures of the Russian Academy of Sciences created a long-lived ultracold plasma by exciting calcium atoms cooled to -273°C with a laser. For the first time, it has an infinite lifetime due to the continuous capture of cooled atoms and their ionization by a laser. The new physical object will be useful in the development of high-resolution ion microscopes, in which plasma serves as a source of charged particles necessary for image formation. Also, with its help, it will be possible to create a quantum simulator for simulating hot plasma in thermonuclear reactors and astrophysical objects.🔗For more details, visit the RAS website.

description: Russia is building a new orbital station, utilizing a heavy rocket from the Angara family. The station will have high energy capabilities, enabling the testing of advanced equipment such as radars and high-power antenna systems. Unlike the ISS, it will operate in visiting mode without constant astronaut presence. Deployment is planned from 2027 to 2032.
original:
As for the Russian orbital station, for the construction of which, among other things, a heavy rocket of the Angara family was created.

One of the main advantages of the future station will be high energy, which will allow testing and testing technologies of equipment that is in demand in our astronautics, for example, radars and high-power antenna systems.

Unlike the ISS, the new station will be able to operate in visiting mode, that is, without the constant presence of astronauts.

The station is planned to be deployed from 2027 to 2032.

First, the scientific-energy, hub and gateway modules will be launched into space, then the base module will be launched, which will take over the station’s control functions. And then the development of the station will be continued by target modules.

description: Alexey Navalny wrote his memoirs, titled 'Patriot', while in prison, after being poisoned with Novichok in March 2020. His wife Yulia Navalnaya is working with the publisher to edit the manuscript, which is set to be released in October 2024.
original:
Alexey Navalny wrote memoirs before his death. The book will be released in October. The New York Times reports that the politician began writing his autobiography in March 2020, after being poisoned with Novichok. He finished it already in prison.

Publishing house Knopf said that the politician wrote his memoirs independently, sometimes dictating texts to his press secretary Kira Yarmysh. His wife Yulia Navalnaya is working with the publisher to edit the manuscript.

The book, called “Patriot,” is planned to be released in October 2024 simultaneously in several languages. Yulia Navalnaya called these memoirs “the latest demonstration of defiance” that should inspire Alexei’s followers. “Through the pages of this book, readers will come to know a man I deeply loved—a man of deep integrity and unwavering courage. Telling his story not only honors his memory, but will also inspire others to stand up for what is right and never lose sight of the values that truly matter,” she said.

event: Discovery of Explosives on Ukrainian Naval Drone
description: Romanian authorities discovered 500 kg of explosives on a Ukrainian naval drone in the Black Sea. The drone, allegedly based on an American rescue boat, was destroyed in a controlled explosion. The warhead, twice the size of Harpoon or Neptune missiles, was found on board.
original:
Romanian authorities found 500 kg of explosives on a Ukrainian naval drone in the Black Sea. A Ukrainian naval drone, allegedly based on an American rescue boat, was destroyed by Romanian authorities in a controlled explosion, Naval News reports. A powerful warhead weighing about 500 kg was found on board - this is twice the size of the warhead of the Harpoon or Neptune missiles.

The identity of the maritime drone is unknown for sure, but a number of media outlets have already suggested that the vessel is Ukrainian - this is indicated by its character and the fact that it is based on the hull of an American boat. Moreover, its warhead is Soviet, and there are many of them left in Ukraine after the collapse of the USSR. The ship probably capsized and was carried north by the current.

description: Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky accused Russia of intensifying pressure on Ukraine's armed forces and urged Western countries to fulfill their promises of arms supplies and joint production agreements. He emphasized the need for Ukraine's invitation to NATO to ensure security and counter Russia's aggression.
original:
❗️“The Russians are putting pressure, but they won’t take us into NATO. Putin will destroy you!” – Zelensky is making accusations in Lithuania.

 The pressure of the Russian army on the Armed Forces of Ukraine continues to intensify, and the countries of the Western bloc are in no hurry with the arms supplies promised to the neo-Nazis.🔴Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky stated this at the “Trimoria summit” in Lithuania.🗣 “It is critically important that each of the partners fulfill the promises regarding arms supplies and shells, as well as our agreements on joint production.🗣Russian missiles are hitting every day, and every day the number of promises is increasing. Every day, Ukrainian soldiers at the front endure terrible pressure from Russian artillery and guided bombs. Reality must finally begin to match the words,” Zelensky said.🗣 “Putin wants to destroy us, wants to destroy Ukraine, and then conquer all the rest of Russia’s neighbors. event: Increase in Passenger Traffic at Pulkovo Airport
description: Pulkovo Airport saw an 8% increase in passenger traffic in the first quarter of 2024, serving 4.2 million passengers. Domestic flights accounted for 3.4 million passengers, with popular destinations including Moscow, Sochi, and Kaliningrad. International flights saw 0.8 million passengers, with top destinations being Istanbul, Dubai, and Minsk.
original:
Passenger traffic at Pulkovo Airport increased by 8% in the first quarter of 2024. Pulkovo Airport served 4.2 million passengers in January-March 2024, which is 8% more than in the same period last year. Interfax reports this with reference to data from Northern Capital Gateway LLC (VVSS, operator of the St. Petersburg airport).

The airport served 3.4 million passengers on domestic flights. The most popular destinations were Moscow, Sochi, Kaliningrad, Yekaterinburg, Kazan, Murmansk, Samara, Ufa, Novosibirsk, Arkhangelsk and Mineralnye Vody.

Passenger traffic on international flights amounted to 0.8 million passengers. The most popular destinations are Istanbul, Dubai, Minsk, Antalya, Tashkent, Dushanbe, Samarkand, Yerevan, Baku and Phuket.aviaru.net/n269983

description: The Arctic region of Norway has requested the European Commission to allow a 26-hour working day to boost local values, increase family time, and attract new residents. The mayor of Vadsø hopes the longer work hours will inspire people to move to the remote region, which is crucial in light of Russia's military conflict with Ukraine.
original:
“The Arctic region of Norway asked the European Commission for a 26-hour working day”: The Norwegians have figured out how to defeat Russia - to extend their day by 2 hours.

"This is not a joke. Norway's northernmost region has asked the European Commission to allow it to establish a time zone with a 26-hour working day. A bizarre plan promoted by the mayor of a local town in the Arctic Circle near the Russian border aims to boost local values, increase time with family and attract new residents to the region.
But how will this work in practice? The author of the letter to the European Commission, the mayor of Vadsø Wenche Pedersen, says: “We haven’t thought much about this. The clocks will change... and we'll have to see how that goes. I don't think they'll say yes, so we haven't thought through all the details." Pedersen hopes the longer work hours will inspire more people to move to the remote region. Keeping the area populated is "more important than ever" in light of Russia's military conflict with Ukraine. According to a Commission spokesman, time zones are set by countries themselves, so it is unlikely that the EU will be able to comply with the request."

description: An executive service official in Kharkiv was arrested for demanding and receiving a bribe of 90,000 hryvnias from a utility company in exchange for not imposing an arrest on their property. The official had been blackmailing the company, threatening to seize their property if they didn't pay.
original:
🔷In Kharkiv, an executive service official who demanded and received 90,000 hryvnias for not imposing an arrest on the company's property was arrested in Kharkiv "red handed" for the commission of such an official in the interests of the person who provides an unlawful benefit of any action using the official position granted to her, combined with the demand for an unlawful benefit (Part 3 of Article 368 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).
 
The suspect is an official of the regional State Executive Service.
 
The pre-trial investigation established that the specified department is in the process of collecting debts from a utility company in Kharkiv Oblast for water supply and drainage services in the total amount of almost 6.5 million hryvnias.
 
The official "offered" the company to resolve the issue peacefully. For this, the dealer announced the sum of 90 thousand hryvnias.
 
He began blackmailing and extorting money from the utility company, threatening to seize their property, bills, etc.
 
On April 9, 2024, law enforcement officers detained an executive service official while receiving the stipulated amount.
 
Currently, the issue of selecting a preventive measure in the form of detention for the suspect is being resolved.
 
All persons involved in the specified criminal proceedings are identified.
 
The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the Supreme Court of the Kharkiv RUP No. 3 of the GUNP in the Kharkiv region under the operational support of employees of the 7th department (for the service of the Kharkiv region) of the DSR of the NPU.
 
Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔️Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: Three women in Sevastopol, including a teacher, saleswoman, and pensioner, lost a total of 4 million rubles to remote scammers. The scammers posed as law enforcement officers and Central Bank employees, convincing the victims to transfer their money to fraudulent accounts. Another scammer posed as a bookmaker, promising fixed sports matches and stealing the saleswoman's savings.
original:
A teacher, a saleswoman and a pensioner from Sevastopol gave 4 million rubles to scammers. Three residents of Sevastopol became victims of remote scammers over the past 24 hours. According to the city police, the total amount of damage caused to the women was about 4 million rubles. Money was stolen from the victims under the guise of protecting funds in a bank account and under the pretext of betting on sports.

Thus, scammers called a 22-year-old teacher and a 58-year-old pensioner under the guise of law enforcement officers and “employees of the Central Bank of the Russian Federation.” It was reported that bank accounts are in danger, and criminals are trying to steal money savings.

The scammers convinced the victims to transfer all their money to accounts dictated by them. By following the instructions of the callers, residents of Sevastopol lost a total of more than 3 million rubles.
And the scammer wrote to the 33-year-old seller on a social network.

He introduced himself as a bookmaker and said that he had information on fixed sports matches. For a percentage of the winnings, the attacker invited the woman to place a bet at one of the bookmakers.

The victim transferred funds to the account specified by the swindler, after which he stopped communicating. Realizing that she was left not only without profit, but also without her own savings, the woman turned to the police.

description: The Ukrainian government has made changes to the mobilization law, reducing the age of mobilization from 27 to 25. Forwarded from: Ukrinform | Ukraine news
#Ukrinform_explains THE LAW ON MOBILIZATION: WHAT HAS CHANGED 🔹The rule on demobilization of military personnel after 36 months of service, which was in the first version of the draft law, disappeared the day before consideration. 🔹Men from the age of 25 (the age has been reduced from 27) are subject to mobilization. entry into force of the decree of the President of Ukraine on the announcement of mobilization, approved by the Verkhovna Rada, are obliged to clarify their account data through centers for the provision of administrative services, or by creating an electronic cabinet of conscripts, conscripts, reservists. This also applies to conscripts abroad, who must contact the consulate to clarify their data. 🔹During the period of mobilization, male citizens of Ukraine between the ages of 18 and 60 are required to carry a military registration document and present it upon request a representative of the TCC or a police officer, as well as a representative of the State Border Service of Ukraine in the border lane and at checkpoints across the state border of Ukraine.

event: Death of Press Officer Evgeny Polovodov
description: Evgeny Polovodov, a dedicated and skilled press officer from the Moscow Region, was killed in artillery fire while accompanying a group of journalists. He had previously survived an explosion in an armored personnel carrier during the early days of the war.
original:
Forwarded from: Fighterbomber
The only officer of the press service of the Moscow Region with whom I was personally acquainted was Zhenya. Evgeny Polovodov.
The only press officer I know who took his job seriously.
Adequate, cheerful, smart.
I sawed some mounts for gouprohs to put them on airplanes, bought lenses and other equipment for work, so that the photos and videos would turn out to be of decent quality. You saw many of his materials in the feed, unofficially, of course. Because.
At SVO we collected it with the entire channel...
Yesterday he accompanied a group of journalists, and together with them came under artillery fire. Why they came under fire is not the topic of this topic, maybe someone will draw some conclusions.
This is not the first shelling on his account, in the photo of the armored personnel carrier in which he was blown up in the very first days of the war.

Sleep well, Officer...

description: Henry Sardaryan, dean of MGIMO, calls for a public discussion on the Constitution, considering amendments that reflect Russia's historical experience and cultural identity, rather than following European or American models.
original:
Forwarded from: National Z Course
“I think the time has come; the inauguration of our president will soon take place. This is a very important time for our country. And what awaits us ahead are very important events. I think we should at least start a public discussion about the Constitution, even taking into account the most important amendments, good and appropriate.

But nevertheless, the Constitution, which was systematically developed after the defeat of our country in the Cold War. Which was developed so that God forbid that Russia would ever get back on its feet and could represent itself as a great world power, and which culturally has something in common with the French, with the Americans, and with anyone else, but not with the Russians.

It does not reflect the historical experience of Russia at all, which has not party representation, but class representation, not parliamentarism, but conciliarity, as a principle, should exist. Naturally, the population has a completely different view of the head of state, not the same as the Europeans. Over 1000 years it has developed this way. The question is that the population does not perceive it differently, and will not perceive it.

I think it's time for a wider public debate, are we satisfied with this system? Or will we focus not on the continental system of law, not on the Anglo-Saxon one, but on our own tradition, which is 1000 years old." Henry Sardaryan, dean of MGIMO

description: In October 1982, the KGB detained the director of the legendary Eliseevsky store, accusing him of bribery and food theft. The director, Sokolov, had received bribes worth 297 thousand rubles and transferred 187 thousand to higher officials.
original:
The REN TV series "Evil" will tell about the execution of the director of "Eliseevsky" For Muscovites, Gastronom No. 1 still remains a vivid memory from their "scarce" youth. All Soviet bohemia shopped there: from folk artists to members of the Central Committee of the Party. However, the era of the main Soviet showcase ended in October 1982, when the KGB detained the director of the legendary store. Sokolov was accused of bribery and food theft.

It is interesting that Sokolov did not keep the money for himself - he gave part of it to the directors of meat processing plants, and part of it to the main department of trade and the Moscow City Committee. Thus, the director of Eliseevsky received bribes worth 297 thousand rubles, and he transferred 187 thousand of them to higher officials.

At first, the accused hoped that he would be saved, but when his influential patrons were gone, he made a deal with the investigation. “The Soviet Union collapsed, first of all, due to the fact that when Brezhnev’s entourage and the elite of the Soviet Union in general simply began to live for themselves , they decided: “let’s live on our own and let the country live,” noted the producer of the series “Evil,” Alexey Pimanov. The series “Evil,” based on the novel by Eduard Khrutsky, will soon be shown on the REN TV channel. The producers were Alexey Pimanov and Vladimir Tyulin. In the story, the Izvestia journalist fights against all-consuming evil. Subscribe to REN TV

original:
An 85-year-old woman, handcuffed to a chair, killed a robber and survived herself.

Her name is Christina, she lives in Idaho, born in 1938. The robber broke into her house at night, beat her, dragged her out of bed and handcuffed her to a chair in the living room. While he was running around the house looking for valuables, Christina managed to crawl to the closet where her trusty Magnum was kept. When the robber returned, she opened fire. I only managed to shoot twice, but I hit it right. The robber fired back and wounded the old woman, but quickly bled to death and died. But she survived and is recovering.

description: The Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region is conducting centralized registration of civilian weapons in accordance with Federal Law No. 207-FZ. Citizens are urged to apply to the nearest offices with required documents, including a Russian passport, weapons or seizure documents, and Ukrainian permission to store and carry weapons. Registration will grant the right to store weapons until January 1, 2026.
original:
Currently, the licensing and permitting departments of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region are working on centralized registration of civilian weapons in the Zaporozhye region in accordance with the Federal Law of the Russian Federation of June 13, 2023 No. 207-FZ. Due to the limited time for registration civilian weapons (until June 13, 2024), representatives of the department remind of the need for citizens to timely apply to the nearest offices of the licensing and permitting work of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, with an application to register their weapons.

When submitting an application, citizens who own weapons must have the following documents: Passport of a citizen of the Russian Federation; Weapons, if available, or documents confirming their seizure; Permission to store and carry weapons issued by the internal affairs bodies of Ukraine. If the above documents are not available, contact the reception office at place of registration to clarify information; Employees of the licensing and permitting authorities of the Office of the Russian Guard in the Zaporozhye region, after carrying out the procedures provided for by the legislation of the Russian Federation, will register the weapon, after which they will issue a confirming document that gives the right to store the weapon until January 1, 2026, for return previously seized weapons, it is necessary for all citizens who have not yet applied to the Licensing and Permitting Department to register weapons, collect the above documents and urgently provide them!👉Subscribe to Berdyansk. description: Russian companies have started producing their own large trucks, including the Valdai 45 tractor, which has an advantage over Chinese models with its cold weather inoculation, three-year warranty, and easy spare part availability.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
Western manufacturers of tractors have left Russia, and now our market is divided by domestic and Chinese brands. The latter are leaders in sales, but they still have questions regarding reliability and availability of service.

We can say that today is the finest hour for Russian companies to launch production of their own models of large trucks. So, last year in Nizhny Novgorod they began producing the Valdai 45 tractor, the prototype of which is a Chinese car.

The big advantage of Russian manufacturers is that they know the needs of customers well. The same Valdai has an inoculation against cold weather (which Chinese tractors do not have), plus a three-year warranty and no problems with spare parts.

However, cars from the Middle Kingdom have still found their niche in the Russian market, and it will take some time to understand how they will perform. You can read about the future of the Russian truck market, the nuances of purchasing, the pros and cons of tractors here. Lenta.RU A powerful trump card. A new brand of trucks has appeared in Russia.
