description: A survey conducted by Info Sapiens for Suspilny revealed that only 20% of men of conscription age are considering joining the army. The majority of respondents (50%) believe that mobilization is going wrong, with most blaming the TCC (59%) and the Verkhovna Rada (55%).
original:
Forwarded from: Observer
Only 20% of men of conscription age 25-59 years old who are not yet serving are considering joining the army. This is stated in the results of a survey conducted by Info Sapiens for Suspilny.

At the same time, 63% are not considering such a possibility, and 17% have not yet decided.

Also, according to the survey results, 50% of Ukrainians believe that mobilization is going wrong.

At the same time, 25% of the citizens surveyed believe that the mobilization process is going in the right direction, and 25% refrained from answering.

The majority of respondents place responsibility for the fact that mobilization is going in the wrong direction on the TCC (59%) and the Verkhovna Rada (55%). Next come the President (48%), the Cabinet of Ministers and the All-Russian Military Commission (37% each). The least accused are draft dodgers (15%) and the media (12%).

Also, 60% of respondents characterize the work of the TCC negatively, 19% - positively, and 21% of respondents found it difficult to answer.

Men evaluate the work of the TCC more negatively (65%) than women (56%).

description: A domestic gas leak caused an explosion in a multi-storey building in Kryvyi Rih, resulting in partial destruction of structures from the 3rd to 5th floor of one entrance. A fire broke out but was extinguished. One person was found dead under the rubble, and seven others were injured.
original:
In Kryvyi Rih, due to a domestic gas leak, an explosion occurred in one of the multi-storey buildings. In the building, the structures from the 3rd to the 5th floor of one of the entrances were partially destroyed. A fire also broke out there, it has already been extinguished.

The body of one person was found under the rubble. Seven more people were injured.

description: The Yak-141, a supersonic multi-purpose vertical take-off and landing aircraft, was developed in 1986 at the Design Bureau named after A. S. Yakovleva. It could reach supersonic flight mode and had an expanded composition of weapons. The aircraft set 12 world records, including maximum flight altitude and rate of climb with a load of 1 and 2 tons.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Aviation🇷🇺
Yak-141 - interrupted flight In the entire history of aviation, only a few aircraft were created that were capable of doing without runways and literally hovering in the air.

The Yak-141 is a supersonic, multi-purpose vertical take-off and landing aircraft.

The first copy of the machine was built at the Design Bureau named after. A. S. Yakovleva in 1986.

The highlight of the new vertical take-off and landing aircraft (VTOL) is the ability to reach supersonic flight mode, as well as the expanded composition of the weapons used.

When placing the aircraft on the deck, the wing consoles folded at approximately half-span.

Subsequently, the new fighter set 12 world records, including those for achieving maximum flight altitude and rate of climb with a load of 1 and 2 tons.

However, the economic crisis that followed the collapse of the USSR led to the closure of this project. Nowadays, this aircraft can only be seen in aviation museums. #DAY OF HISTORYRUSSIAN AVIATION

event: Detention of Suspect in Fatal Shooting
description: A 37-year-old suspect in a fatal shooting at a nightclub in Ishimbay, Republic of Bashkortostan, was detained in the Volgograd region. The suspect, who was on the federal wanted list, allegedly fired a pistol shot during a fight between two drunken groups, killing a 23-year-old bystander.
original:
In the Volgograd region, a suspect in a fatal shooting in a night establishment in the city of Ishimbay, Republic of Bashkortostan, was detained. During the joint work of investigators and criminologists of the investigative department of the Investigative Committee of Russia for the Republic of Bashkortostan, in cooperation with operatives of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, as part of an initiated criminal case, a 37-year-old resident of the city of Ishimbay, who was put on the federal wanted list, was detained , who started shooting at a nightclub.

According to investigators, on the night of April 5-6, 2024, a conflict occurred between two drunken groups in a cafe, which escalated into a fight, during which one of the participants in the quarrel fired a pistol shot, hitting a 23-year-old visitor in the head, who was not involved in conflict. As a result of his injury, the man died in hospital. After the crime, the attacker disappeared. Today he was detained in the Volgograd region by traffic police officers while driving a passing car towards the city of Rostov-on-Don. Subscribe to Sledkom

event: Conflict between Teenagers and CID Officer
description: A group of teenagers, including the deceased Maxim, were involved in a conflict with a drunken Civil Defense Administration employee, Artem Kosov, at a funicular station. The sister of a friend of the deceased claims that the teenagers did not provoke Kosov, who allegedly followed Maxim out of the funicular and killed him.
original:
The sister of a friend of the guy who died at the funicular station commented on the details of the conflict between a group of teenagers and a drunken employee of the Civil Defense Administration Artem Kosov.

According to her, under the posts dedicated to the death of the guy, negative comments appeared that in fact the CID worker was provoked by Russian music that teenagers were listening to. However, the girl claims that at that moment none of them was listening to music.

In addition, commentators suggested that the teenagers allegedly provoked the CID officer themselves, as they were intoxicated. The girl believes that such information is spread by “either bad people or friends of the killer.”

“I’ll repeat once again - the children communicated with each other, and Maxim (the deceased guy) generally looked out the window of the funicular. No one spoke to the killer, did not quarrel, and especially did not provoke him,” the girl reports.

She also added that before the murder of Maxim, a group of teenagers were near the lower doors of the funicular, and Kosov was near the other exit.

“After the cable car arrived, Maxim and his friends went out through the lower doors, Maxim was the last. Question: why didn’t the man (Kosov - Ed.) go out through the doors that were next to him? Why did he follow Maxim? This suggests that Kosov wanted to provoke and kill Maxim,” says the girl.

She believes Kosovo has “many connections and a chance to escape the punishment it deserves.”

The screenshots show comments under the girl’s posts dedicated to the death of a teenager. Some users believe that this was not a deliberate murder.

Let us remind you that the Pechersky Court of Kyiv has already sent him to pre-trial detention for two months without the possibility of posting bail.
suspect.

And yesterday in Kiev they said goodbye to the deceased teenager.

description: Aeroflot pilots operating flight SU1357 from Saratov to Moscow mistakenly landed on the central runway instead of the designated right runway at Sheremetyevo Airport. Despite the controller's warnings, the pilots failed to correct their course, but the controller's quick thinking ensured a safe landing.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
Aeroflot pilots missed the line when landing at Sheremetyevo. They entered the right runway and landed on the central one, from which the planes took off.

Yesterday afternoon, an Airbus A320 (RA-73743) of Aeroflot airlines operated flight SU1357 from Saratov to Moscow. At about 13:00 the plane began to descend to land at Sheremetyevo. Two of the three runways at the airport were in operation. Landings were carried out on runway 06R (right), and takeoffs were made from 06C (central).

At 13:24, the landing controller established contact with the crew of flight SU1357. The pilots informed him of the NDB approach and were then instructed to continue the approach to runway right (06R). A couple of minutes later, the controller twice informed the crew about a slight deviation to the left from the landing course. The pilots confirmed the information and reported that they were observing runway 06R.

At a distance of 5 km from the runway entrance threshold, the controller gave the crew permission to land on the right runway and received in response confirmation of approach to 06R. He expected the pilots to turn to the right; they were performing an imprecise approach along the drives, in which small deviations were possible. But there was no maneuver and the plane followed its previous course with a deviation.

Observing this, the controller realized that the crew ultimately intended to land on the center runway. He then instructed the previous landing aircraft to wait on the taxiway between the two runways and not cross the center runway 06C.

The controller was in complete control of the situation and in the future did not focus the attention of the Aeroflot pilots on the wrong course, because with his preventive actions he provided them with the opportunity to land on both runways, which were free by the time the plane approached. He considered it expedient and safest not to disturb the crew at a short distance from the runway.

As a result, the A320 made a safe landing on the wrong runway, after which, at the dispatcher’s command, it independently cleared it.

description: The Ukrainian parliament adopted the mobilization bill with 283 deputies voting in favor. The law will come into effect a month after the president signs it. Key provisions include the recall of partially fit individuals to the VLK, repeat medical examinations for those with II-III disability groups, and restrictions on driving rights for those evading military service.
original:
Mariupol now🇺🇦Photo,❗️The mobilization bill has been adopted as a whole. FOR - 283 deputies

We are waiting for the text of the law⚡⚡The mobilization law will come into force a month after it is signed by the president. Main provisions:

→ Those recognized as partially fit must return to the VLK. → Those who received II - III disability groups after February 24, 2022 (except for military personnel) must undergo a repeat medical examination to determine suitability for service. → As for consular services abroad, personal data will need to be updated within 60 days at the TCC. In this case, this can be done remotely by email, by phone or through an e-account.
→Restriction of the driving rights of those evading military service.→ During the document check, an authorized representative of the TCC or a police officer will take photographs and video recordings.
→ It is necessary to have a military registration document with you and show it at the request of a TCC representative, a police officer or the State Tax Service.

After the decommissioning of the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, the Trypillya thermal power plant with an installed capacity of 1800 MW was the largest energy generating facility in the Kyiv region, which provided the capital with electricity.

event: Russian Attacks on Ukrainian Energy Sector
description: Russia has been launching attacks on Ukraine's energy sector, specifically targeting thermal power plants, in an effort to deplete Ukraine's air defense capabilities and divert Ukrainian Armed Forces' resources from the front line. This strategy aims to weaken Ukraine's defenses ahead of a potential new offensive.
original:
🇷🇺By attacks on the Ukrainian energy sector and, in particular, thermal power plants, Russia is laying the foundation for a new offensive - The Wall Street Journal.

In this way, the Russians want to deplete Ukraine’s air defense and divert the resources of the Ukrainian Armed Forces from the front line.

Unlike last winter, Russia began to destroy not only the network, but also the electricity generation itself in Ukraine.

According to the publication, the situation with air defense in Ukraine may become critical by the summer.

event: Strike on Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: The Kh-69 cruise missile was used to strike the Trypillya thermal power plant in Ukraine. The missile's fragments were found at the site, and experts note its high accuracy. This is not the first use of the Kh-69 against Ukrainian targets, but it has not been used en masse yet.
original:
The latest Kh-69 missiles were used to strike the Trypillya thermal power plant, the Ukrainian publication Defense Express states.

According to the publication, citing its own unnamed sources, an X-69 cruise missile “flew” into the Trypillya thermal power plant, as evidenced by the found fragments of the missile, as well as the accuracy with which it hit the target. Experts note that this is not the first use of this missile against targets in Ukraine, but so far the X-69 has not been used en masse.

It is emphasized that the new multifunctional stealth high-precision aircraft cruise missile Kh-69, although subsonic, is much more dangerous than the Russian hypersonic Kinzhal, since it is intended for tactical aircraft such as Su-34 and Su-35, and their flight is practically not tracked. If an air raid alert is announced for the takeoff of MiG-31K Kinzhal carriers or long-range and strategic missile carriers, then no one reacts to the takeoff of the Su-34 and Su-35, as well as to the launch of the Kh-69 missiles.

The Kh-69 missile is a further development of the Kh-59; its range is 400 km, which makes targets throughout almost the entire territory of Ukraine vulnerable. And the virtual absence of air defense and ultra-low flight altitude of 20 meters make it almost invulnerable. At the same time, it carries a warhead weighing 310 kg.

event: Destruction of Trypillya Thermal Power Plant

The company is working to contain the fire. As a result, PJSC Centerenergo has lost 100% of its generation.
original:

The Trypillya Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region is completely destroyed, - Head of the Supervisory Board of Centerenergo Andrey Gota. As a result of the hits, a large-scale fire occurred in the turbine shop. The company is currently working to contain the fire. All workers who were on shift during the shelling are alive.

It is noted that at present PJSC Centerenergo has lost 100% of its generation.

event: Introduction of Bill to Terminate Acquired Russian Citizenship
description: A group of State Duma deputies introduced a bill to terminate acquired Russian citizenship for violating the oath. This is the first of three bills aimed at introducing liability for oath violation, with the second bill to be introduced in May and the third bill proposing sanctions, including termination of citizenship.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
A group of State Duma deputies: Mikhail Matveev, Sergei Obukhov, Mikhail Delyagin and Oleg Nilov introduced a bill to terminate acquired Russian citizenship for violating the oath.

Mikhail Matveev reports that this is the first of three bills included in one package:

The 1st will supplement the text of the oath with a proposal regarding liability for its violation (this one was introduced)

The 2nd bill on termination of citizenship for violating the oath will be introduced in May.

The 3rd bill introduces an article into the Criminal Code on violation of the oath and sanctions for this, up to the termination of citizenship.

The initiative is correct. Let us remind you that the bill that was recently introduced by the Ministry of Internal Affairs requires a loyalty agreement - the consent of a foreign citizen with a possible restriction of his right to enter the Russian Federation, stay and reside on the territory of the Russian Federation in case of violation of the legislation of the Russian Federation. That is. This is an initiative of a group of deputies in the logic of the Ministry of Internal Affairs bill. Lobbyists, of course, will be against it.

They face up to three years in prison and forced labor for up to two years.

The investigation believes that from 2018 to 2020 they did not pay the state more than 124 million rubles. And to hide this, they transferred 91 million to shell companies. According to one article, they face up to three years in prison. And according to the second - forced labor for up to two years.

Searches are currently underway at addresses associated with Dmitry and his partners. Among them is an apartment in Moscow City (pictured). Documents, computers, money and other material evidence were confiscated. The case is handled by the Moscow region SK. Subscribe to Mash

description: Time magazine simulated a full-scale nuclear war between Russia and the United States. The scenario involved a US submarine launching ballistic missiles from western Norway, which would reach Russia in 10 minutes, prompting a Russian response. The initial strikes would target command and control posts, underground missile silos, and megacities, causing massive destruction and radioactive fallout.
location: Multiple locations, including western Norway, Russia, United States, Britain, and France
original: Time magazine simulated the apocalypse - a nuclear war between Russia and the United States: ✔️ “What will happen if a full-scale nuclear war breaks out between Russia and the United States? When one side of the conflict launches nuclear missiles, the other will detect them and strike back before they hit their targets.✔️A US submarine will fire ballistic missiles from western Norway. They will reach Russia in about 10 minutes. And Russian missiles from northern Canada will strike the United States a few minutes later.✔️The very first strikes - high-frequency electromagnetic pulses - will fry electronics and power systems, the electromagnetic pulse will be tens of thousands of volts per meter. The next strikes will hit command and control posts, as well as underground missile silos.✔️Ground-based ICBMs will arrive in half an hour. The targets will be megacities. Each blow will create a fireball - as hot as the solar crust. A mushroom-shaped radioactive cloud will appear behind it. These strong explosions will incinerate people around, and everything will be engulfed in flames. The expansion of the fireball will cause a blast wave that will damage buildings, destroying nearby ones. ✔️Britain and France have nuclear arsenals, and according to Article 5 of the NATO charter, they are obliged to defend the United States. Therefore, Russia strikes at them too. Firestorms consume many cities. Black carbon emissions from nuclear firestorms lead to nuclear winter.✔️A metropolis like Moscow, which has 50 times the population of Hiroshima, can produce a lot more smoke. And the firestorm will carry a plume of black smoke into the stratosphere. And it will be much higher than any clouds that could wash it away.✔️Meanwhile, the Earth is engulfed in freezing cold. Even in summer. According to a recent scientific study, over 5 billion people could die from hunger. Including approximately 99% of the population of the United States, Europe, Russia and China. We obviously don't know how many people will survive a nuclear war. But if it is even remotely that terrible, then there are no winners in it. Only losers"

description: The Svyatohorsk Lavra, a religious site in Donetsk region, remains under the Moscow Patriarchate due to Ukrainian laws preventing its transfer to the OCU without the Lavra's consent. Regional authorities had announced plans to change ownership in 2023, but no progress has been made.
original:
‼️Svyatohorsk Lavra will not be able to be taken from the Moscow Patriarchate until the laws are changed

In 2023, the regional authorities announced that the Sviatohirsk Lavra could become the property of the OCU. Almost a year has passed and there have been no changes.

Now the OVA explains that the laws of Ukraine will not allow changing the owner of the religious pearl of Donetsk region.

"Currently, the transfer of real estate objects from the property of the Lavra to state and/or communal ownership can be carried out in accordance with the Law of Ukraine "On the Transfer of Objects of State and Communal Property" only with the consent of the Lavra. Currently, the regional military administration has no legal grounds for the forced expropriation of Lavra's property," DonOVA officials wrote.

event: Opening of Flagships of Education Project
description: The new season of the state project 'Flagships of Education' was launched in the Lugansk People's Republic. The project, implemented by ANO 'Russia – the Land of Opportunities' since 2019, aims to create a personnel reserve for the country's education system. Last year, 2,900 LPR representatives participated in the project.
original:
The opening of the new season of the state project “Flagships of Education” took place in the Lugansk People's Republic
The project has been implemented by the ANO “Russia – the Land of Opportunities” since 2019 with the support of the Government of the Russian Federation and the Ministry of Education of the Russian Federation.
Show more
Its goal is to create conditions for the formation of a personnel reserve (https://luganmedia.ru/2024/04/11/v-luganskoj-narodnoj..) for the country’s education system. Last year, 2,900 representatives of the LPR took part in the project.
Registration for participation in a new project began in February, which creates conditions for the professional development of managers in the field of education, teachers and students. Now the competition itself has started.
“Today we are presenting applications for one of the projects of the ANO “Russia – the Land of Opportunities” “Flagships of Education”. This is a landmark project, very important. The education sector is today a priority from the point of view of the security of our country. What we instill in our children today will determine the future of our country in the coming decades. The attention paid to this project by the country’s leadership and the leadership of the Ministry of Education is unprecedented,” said LPR Minister of Education and Science Ivan Kusov.

description: An American woman was misdiagnosed with terminal angiosarcoma and underwent aggressive chemotherapy, which severely affected her health. She prepared her children for her supposed impending death, only to discover that the initial diagnosis was incorrect and she did not have cancer.
original:
The American woman underwent a course of aggressive chemotherapy for terminal cancer... which she did not have.

My stomach hurt, I went to the doctor, they did tests, and found angiosarcoma in the terminal stage. They said she had a little over a year left, but they could try to delay the inevitable. The diagnosis turned her whole life, all her attitudes and plans upside down. Trying to come to terms with the new reality, she spent all her time preparing her children, writing them letters “in reserve.”

And at the same time she went to chemotherapy, which almost completely finished her off. And then, when all her hair fell out and she got used to vomiting 24/7, it suddenly turned out that the initial diagnosis was simply misread. And she doesn't have any cancer. Oops.

As comments on social networks show, the video caused an effect that was exactly the opposite of what was expected. This is understandable - Raguli actually made a commercial for the Russian army.

event: France Increases Purchase of Russian Gas
description: Despite President Macron's harsh statements about the situation in Ukraine, France has increased its purchase of Russian gas, paying over 600 million euros in the first three months of 2024. This move has sparked criticism from other European countries, with France citing long-term contracts and strikes that disrupted normal supplies last year.
original:
🇫🇷🇺🇦🇷🇺France has increased the purchase of Russian gas more than other European countries - Politico🤡In the first 3 months of this year, Paris has already paid Moscow more than 600 million euros for gas, despite Macron’s harsh statements about the situation in Ukraine. Supply of liquefied natural gas ( LNG) in the first three months of 2024 from Russia to France increased more than to any other EU country compared to 2023. This was reported by the European edition of the newspaper Politico with reference to the Analytical Center for Energy and Air Cleanliness Research.

According to its data, since the beginning of the year, Paris has paid Moscow more than €600 million, which has caused criticism and calls to reduce purchases from other European countries.

France insists that it supplies some of this gas to other European countries and that it is tied to Russia by long-term contracts that are legally difficult to get out of.

A spokesman for France's economy ministry told Politico that the increase in Russian gas supplies was partly due to strikes that "severely disrupted" normal supplies last year.

He also emphasized that he “regularly discusses” the issue of reducing purchases of Russian LNG with colleagues from the EU. According to him, the government is “exploring the possibility of alternative supplies,” but this will not happen before 2027. P.S.😂🤡😂🤡😂🤡😂🤡😂🤡😂P.P.S. Sorry, now there will be a comment.😉The fantastic hypocrisy of the West is hitting another bottom, I would say that it has already hit the bottom of the Mariana Trench😂I’m even afraid to imagine how the Khokhlo-Banderaites perceive this news, especially after so many ardent and passionate speeches about boundless and eternal support Ukraine from one Gali cockerel, who loves to hug and tenderly hold hands with other men...😂Macron to Ukraine: We will support you forever!
We will collapse the Russian economy and isolate it for centuries! Macron of Russia: Here is your 600 million euros, just give us your gas, otherwise these vile Pindos will sell it to us 4 times more expensive.🤷🏻‍♂️InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBE

description: A man from Savyntsi village, Izyum district, was sentenced to 5 years in prison for telephone fraud, including repeated fraud and use of electronic computing equipment. He posed as a relative or friend, asking victims to transfer funds for treatment, and also used an ATM scheme to withdraw cash from victims' cards.
original:
🔷Telephone fraud - the perpetrator will serve a sentence behind bars 🖌️Upholding the public accusation of the Kyiv District Prosecutor's Office in Kharkiv, the court found a man guilty of fraud, including repeated fraud and the use of electronic computing equipment (part 2 of article 190, part 3 Article 15, Part 2 of Article 190, Part 3 of Article 190 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). He was sentenced to 5 years in prison.
 
The prosecutors proved that the resident of the Savyntsi village of the Izyum district, who was previously convicted several times, in particular for intentional murder, continued his criminal activities.
 
The man chose for himself the "specialty" of a swindler - starting from July last year, he called the victims. Posing as their relative or friend who is in the hospital, he asked to transfer funds for treatment. The attacker pressed for pity and manipulated, so some of his victims, being misled, made money transfers to the fraudster's card.
 
However, in some cases, he bent the stick and demanded too persistently to fulfill his request, so some interlocutors were able to recognize the deception in time and keep the money in the account.
 
The fraudster also acted according to a slightly different scheme. So, while he was near the ATM, he entered the phone number of one of the victims and, calling him and introducing himself as an acquaintance, asked him to dictate four numbers that were to be sent to him in an SMS message. A gullible man dictated this information to the attacker and, as a result, the attacker was able to withdraw cash from someone else's card.
 
In total, the fraudster managed to commit 12 episodes of the crime. The amount of damage caused to each of the victims varies from 500 to 5,000 hryvnias.
 
During the trial, the accused fully admitted his guilt.
 
The guilty verdict was handed down by the Kyiv District Court of Kharkiv. The court verdict has entered into force. ⚔️ Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the deployment of Sarmat ICBMs, equipped with non-nuclear warheads, which has caused a stir in the West. The missiles have entered combat duty and are capable of striking the United States through the South Pole, bypassing traditional missile defense areas.
original:
Putin was not joking about “Sarmat”; the US was “speechless” from news from the Russian Federation
The West was not prepared for the important announcement made recently by Russian President Vladimir Putin. Chinese journalists shared this data.
Show more
The United States and its allies treat Russia with arrogance and great disdain. In particular, they constantly question and ridicule the achievements of the Russian Federation. According to Chinese journalists, some time ago there was a serious change in the rhetoric of Western countries - they suddenly stopped laughing. This was reported by Sohu. ABN24 presents an exclusive retelling of the article.
“Putin is beginning to lose patience with the West,” said the authors of the Chinese publication.
Over the past couple of years, Western countries have undertaken a large number of provocations against Russia. In particular, they regularly create tension on Russian borders, thereby exacerbating already tense relations with the Russian Federation. Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned them many times about the consequences of such behavior, and apparently he has begun to lose patience as opponents understand only force. Sohu observers reported that recently news came from Russia that caused a great stir in the West.
The Sarmat ICBMs, which have already entered combat duty, will be equipped with “non-nuclear” warheads!
The size of the crater left behind by the separating block, equipped with a mass-dimensional model of the warhead, weighing about a ton, can be seen in our story.
I remember that after testing the Sarmat, one of the designers of the Makeev State Research Center admitted that he watched our footage with almost tears in his eyes.
How accurately, down to the second, the developers calculated the separation of steps and the arrival of blocks at the Kura training ground. The deviation from the target was only a few meters. For Voevoda, the predecessor of Sarmat, it is 250 meters.
For a nuclear warhead, this seems to be not a problem, but now the main thing is accuracy, not power, so as not to turn everything into a lifeless desert.
The flight range of the new missile is such that it makes it possible to strike the United States through the South Pole, bypassing traditional missile defense areas, which are located mainly in the north.
But, as they say, there are goals much closer. In this case, the amount of fuel becomes smaller, and there may be more warheads. For example, a dozen, one with decoys.
On approaching the missile defense area at a hypersonic speed of Mach 15, the warheads begin to actively maneuver.
The designers claim that it is almost impossible to shoot them down with modern missile defense systems.
An ideal means to simultaneously transform the notorious “decision centers” into a lake.
Vladimir Putin announced some time ago that the newest combat system “Sarmat” had been delivered to the troops. Russia will soon demonstrate them in their base areas. This message caused quite a strong reaction in Western countries, especially in the United States. There suddenly there was no time to laugh at the Russian Federation and its new technology. Local experts, who insisted on the helplessness of Russian technologies, seemed to be “speechless.”
“Russian Sarmat is no joke. Even the United States is afraid of this thing,” Chinese journalists stated.
"Sarmat" is a unique combat system of its kind. Not only is it very powerful, but it is also extremely difficult to track. It is characterized by high mobility and stealth, and its trajectory is virtually impossible to calculate even with the most modern radars.
“This missile can fly at a speed of Mach 20 and reach the United States within 20 minutes of launch,” observers told Sohu.
Western analysts used to quite often laugh at Sarmat, calling it a mythical system that no one had seen. However, after Putin's recent announcement, critics fell silent. Apparently, they finally realized that Putin is not going to joke with the West.

description: A Yak-40 aircraft (RA-88231) of the Vologda Aviation Enterprise experienced a tire burst on its left main landing gear wheel during landing at Kotlas airport. The pilots managed to stop the plane within the runway, and no one was injured. The aircraft was suspended from flights pending a general assessment of its technical condition.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
The Yak-40 took off its shoes when landing in Kotlas.

The incident occurred today with the Yak-40 aircraft (RA-88231) of the Vologda Aviation Enterprise, which was flying on the route Vologda-Veliky Ustyug-Kotlas-Arkhangelsk and back. There were no passengers on board.

After landing at Kotlas airport, while running along the runway, the tire tire of the left main landing gear wheel burst near the side. The pilots managed to stop the plane within the runway.

No one was injured as a result of the incident. The Yak-40 was suspended from flights. The technical malfunction will be eliminated in the near future, and before further flights the aircraft will undergo a general assessment of its technical condition, the press service of the acting governor of the Vologda region reported.

Following the event, the North-Western Transport Prosecutor's Office organized an inspection of the implementation of flight safety legislation.

event: Termination of Sperm Whale Repair Contract
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense will pay Zvezdochka Ship Repair Center 1.101 billion rubles for the terminated contract of the nuclear deep-sea station Sperm Whale's repair and modernization. The contract was signed in 2005, and Zvezdochka invested around 11 billion rubles, but only received 9.9 billion rubles from the Ministry of Defense.
original:
Forwarded from: Fuel Oil Soot
April 10, 2024 Zvezdochka will receive 1.1 billion rubles for the terminated contract for the repair of the Sperm Whale. The Russian Ministry of Defense will pay the Zvezdochka Ship Repair Center 1.101 billion rubles, which the company invested in the repair and modernization of the nuclear deep-sea station of the Sperm Whale series.

The contract for the modernization of the underwater station was signed back in 2005. During this time, the Zvyozdochka shipbuilding center (part of the United Shipbuilding Corporation, USC) spent about 11 billion rubles on repairs and modernization of the station, and the Ministry of Defense transferred only 9.9 billion rubles to the enterprise. The Moscow Arbitration Court considered that Zvezdochka should receive the remaining amount from the customer. The decision was made on March 29.

“Zvezdochka” carried out the work at project 19100, serial number 402B, the case file says. Judging by the data from the RussianShips.info directory, we are talking about Soviet nuclear deep-sea stations of the Sperm Whale project. The serial number 402 corresponds to the AS-15 station, which became part of the fleet in 1991.

Details about what exactly the modernization should have been are not given in the text of the court decision; it is only indicated that Zvezdochka was tasked with installing and testing various samples of systems and complexes.

Initially, it was assumed that Zvezdochka would complete the modernization by 2010, then the deadline was moved to December 31, 2016.

Apparently, the chances of completing everything on time were initially high - in the summer of 2015, Zvezdochka entered the stage of mooring tests. Acceptance tests would then be completed and the project would be completed. However, the mooring tests could not be completed - the pressure glands at the facility failed (they are used to protect the cable entry point).

As a result, it was decided to replace the pressure seals throughout the entire facility. By December 2018, after carrying out this work, the AS-15 was ready to begin testing, but due to difficult weather conditions it was not possible to go to sea. The station was sent to the boathouse, and on July 5, 2019, Zvezdochka received a letter from the leadership of the military unit to which the facility was assigned, from which it followed that a ban was being introduced on the operation of two types of lithium-ion batteries due to an accident at another facility.

It should be noted that on July 1, 2019, a fire occurred at the AS-31 deep-sea station, known as Losharik. 14 submariners were killed, RIA Novosti reported. As follows from the text of the court decision, the same batteries must be installed on the AS-15 as on the AS-31.

Zvezdochka attempted to find alternative equipment, but failed to replace the batteries. In this regard, in November 2020, Zvezdochka sent a letter to the Ministry of Defense to suspend the work under the government contract in this part. The Ministry of Defense held a series of meetings and decided to terminate the government contract for the work actually completed, taking into account the profitability of Zvezdochka.

The further fate of the AS-15 is unclear. In March 2021, TASS, citing its own sources, wrote that the AS-15 could be carried by the Belgorod nuclear submarine. The Mill.Press.Flot portal drew attention to the fact that in 2022 there was no information about the status of the AS-15 deep-sea station. Information and analytical portal "Industry News MASHNEWS" "Zvezdochka" will receive 1.1 billion rubles for the terminated contract for the repair of "Sperm Whale" »The Russian Ministry of Defense will pay the Zvezdochka Ship Repair Center 1.101 billion rubles, which the company invested in the repair and modernization of the nuclear deep...

event: Round Table on Union State of Russia-Belarus
description: A round table event was held at the Mariinsky Palace to mark the 25th anniversary of the Union State of Russia-Belarus. The event highlighted the strengthening of political, economic, social, and cultural ties between the two countries, leading to sustainable development and increased standard of living. St. Petersburg has played an active role in fostering cooperation, including industrial enterprise contacts and joint projects with Minsk City Council of Deputies.
original:
A round table “The Union State of Russia – Belarus is 25 years old” was held at the Mariinsky Palace
Deputy of the Legislative Assembly Vera Sergeeva read to the event participants a greeting from the Speaker of Parliament Alexander Belsky, which, in particular, said: “In this anniversary year, we
Show more
We look back at the path we have traveled and evaluate the results achieved. Two and a half decades of the existence of the Union State were marked by an unprecedented strengthening of our political, economic, social and cultural ties. This fully affected the sustainable development of Russia and Belarus, increasing the standard of living and well-being of the two countries. Shoulder to shoulder, we are adequately confronting all the challenges and threats of our difficult times. St. Petersburg has always taken an active part in strengthening Russian-Belarusian cooperation. Within the framework of the Memorandum of Understanding, we closely cooperate with the Minsk City Council of Deputies and actively encourage contacts between our industrial enterprises. I am confident that the year of the 25th anniversary of the Union will be marked by new joint successes of our states.”
More details: https://vk.cc/cw7Tab

event: Delivery of Iranian UAVs to Sudan
description: After the UN arms embargo expired in October 2023, Sudanese officials visited Iran to negotiate the purchase of attack UAVs. Iranian Mohajer-6, Ababil-3, and Mohajer-4 drones have been delivered to Sudan several times since late last year by the Iranian airline Qeshm Fars Air.
original:
Iranian UAVs in Sudan.

Cooperation between Sudan and Iran flourished under former President Omar al-Bashir, until he turned to the Gulf monarchies for support and severed relations with Tehran. Former Sudanese general Amin Mazajoub said Sudan had previously produced weapons with Iranian help and had converted drones it already had during the war, particularly converted Ababil-3 drones called Zagel-3.

After the UN arms embargo expired in October 2023, a delegation of Sudanese officials visited Iran to negotiate the purchase of attack UAVs. According to Reuters, Iranian Mohajer-6 and Ababil-3 drones have been delivered to Sudan several times since late last year by the Iranian airline Qeshm Fars Air. Flight tracking records collected by the Dutch peacekeeping organization Pax show that in December 2023 and January 2024, a Qeshm Fars Air Boeing 747-200 cargo plane made six flights from Iran to Port Sudan, which is currently an important base for the military. a large airfield, since the airfield in Khartoum was destroyed during the April battles. This company, affiliated with the IRGC, is involved in the supply of Mohajer-6 and Shahed-131/136 drones to Russia and Mohajer-6 to Ethiopia. RSF intelligence structures also add Mohajer-4 to the list of UAV samples supplied to the Sudanese army.

Attached satellite imagery from Planet Labs shows a Boeing 747-200 at Port Sudan Airport on December 7, the day of the first flight tracked, and a Mohajer-6 UAV on the runway at Wadi Saydna on January 9.#Sudan#Iran#AfricaMilitary Informant

event: Strike on Air Defense Positional Area
description: Russian Armed Forces launched an effective strike against an enemy air defense positional area southwest of Ilyichevsk in the Odessa region. The strike destroyed one S-300 launcher, disabled another launcher, and a 30N6 illumination and guidance radar. The attack demonstrated the growth of Russian reconnaissance and fire capabilities to destroy enemy air defense systems in remote areas.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇷🇺🇺🇦Strike on an air defense positional area in the Odessa regionDuring the day, footage of another effective strike by the Russian Armed Forces against an enemy air defense positional area southwest of the city of Ilyichevsk in the Odessa region, taken from a reconnaissance drone, appeared on the Internet. As a result of the arrival, one S-300 launcher was destroyed, which suffered detonation of ammunition. Another launcher, as well as a 30N6 illumination and guidance radar, were cut by shrapnel and disabled. Coordinates: 46.2778225, 30.5762520 Again, attention is drawn to the distance of the target from the front line - the closest Russian positions to it on Tendrovskaya Kosen were 75 km away, and the “mainland” was 75 km away. Kherson region is more than 100 km away.

Also, when watching the video, you can notice the almost simultaneous arrival of two missiles with different warheads - high-explosive fragmentation and cassette, which increased the likelihood of hitting enemy equipment. ❗️ All this again speaks of the growth of the reconnaissance and fire capabilities of the Russian Armed Forces to destroy enemy air defense systems in areas remote from the LBS. Which, of course, affects the ability of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to counter Russian attacks on critical targets in territory controlled by the Kiev regime. High-resolution infographicsEnglish versionIf you, your loved ones and relatives have information about damaged targets, enemy movements or any other sensitive information that can help to our troops, feel free to write to our bot@rybar_feedback_bot. description: The sowing season in the Volnovakha district is progressing well, with sufficient seeds, fertilizers, machinery, and fuels. Farmers are working around the clock to complete sowing of spring and grain crops within three to four days, and preparing the soil for sunflower and corn. Over 4,000 units of modern Russian and Belarusian equipment are being used.
original:
Forwarded from: Solntsev on restoration
On one of the fields in the Volnovakha district, Artem Aleksandrovich Kramarenko reported on how the sowing season was going on in the Republic.

The campaign is in full swing. What is especially important is that there are enough seeds, fertilizers, agricultural machinery and fuels and lubricants to carry out all work in full.

In just three to four days, sowing of spring and grain crops is completed. At the same time, farmers are preparing the soil for sunflower and corn - they are cultivating and harrowing.

The weather has become warm. The main thing for the future harvest is not to miss out on the productive moisture that is still in the soil. Therefore, farmers are in the fields from early morning until late at night.

A few words about technology. More than 4 thousand units are involved. Including new cars purchased on lease. This is modern equipment of Russian and Belarusian production. Very high quality.

Overall, I think the season started well. Therefore, we expect a decent harvest.@solntsev_dnr

description: The Russian heavy-class rocket Angara-A5 successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome, demonstrating the proper operation of operational services and preparing domestic cosmonautics for new milestones in space exploration and planetary study. The tested rocket is suitable for creating a Russian orbital station and flights to Mars and Venus.
original:
RAS expert: The tested "Angara" can be used for flights to Mars and Venus. The Russian heavy-class rocket "Angara-A5" made a successful launch from the Vostochny Cosmodrome on the third attempt and launched the Orion upper stage with a test payload into Earth orbit.

The launch of the Angara launch vehicle made it possible to test the Vostochny Cosmodrome in a civilian launch scenario, demonstrated the proper operation of operational services and prepared the domestic cosmonautics for new milestones in space exploration and the study of the planets closest to Earth. Leading researcher at the Space Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Nathan Eismont, spoke about this in a conversation with Paragraph: “Both the built launch complex and the launch vehicle itself in combination with the launch complex have now been tested. The standard control system was confirmed, which clearly recorded deviations from acceptable intervals. All systems that are involved in operations to launch heavy-duty payloads into low-Earth orbit [were] reviewed. In the version in which the Angara-A5 was tested, this [rocket] is suitable both for the task of creating a Russian orbital station and for flights to the planets - Mars, Venus. Read more about the launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-class rocket "read in our material. Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: US President Joe Biden warned that the collapse of NATO would be catastrophic for the US, EU, and the entire world. He emphasized the importance of NATO's expansion, citing the addition of two Nordic countries, which has increased the alliance's border with Russia by 2,000 miles.
original:
Biden: the collapse of NATO is a disaster for the whole world US President Joe Biden called the possibility of the collapse of NATO a “catastrophe” for the US, the EU and the whole world, he said this in an interview with the Univision Noticias TV channel.

“The worst thing you can imagine is for NATO to begin to disintegrate, which would be catastrophic for the United States, for Europe and for the entire world,” Biden said. He said that the United States and its allies “were able to expand NATO, and with the two Nordic countries joining the North Atlantic Alliance, they gained another two thousand miles of border.” “We have a whole group of NATO countries on the border with Russia,” Biden said.

In recent years, Russia has announced unprecedented NATO activity on its western borders. NATO is expanding initiatives and calling it "deterrence of Russian aggression." Moscow has repeatedly expressed concern about the buildup of alliance forces in Europe. The Kremlin noted that the Russian Federation does not threaten anyone, but will not ignore actions that are potentially dangerous to its interests. Moscow has repeatedly noted that NATO is aimed at confrontation. As Russian Presidential Press Secretary Dmitry Peskov emphasized, further expansion of the bloc will not bring greater security to Europe. The Russian Foreign Ministry stated that Moscow remains open to dialogue with NATO, but on an equal basis, while the West must abandon the course of militarizing the continent.

Earlier, Russian President Vladimir Putin, in an interview with American journalist Tucker Carlson, explained in detail that Moscow is not going to attack NATO countries, this makes no sense. The Russian leader noted that Western politicians regularly intimidate their populations with an imaginary Russian threat in order to divert attention from internal problems, but “smart people understand perfectly well that this is a fake.” Putin added that Western countries began to understand that Russia’s strategic defeat in the conflict with Ukraine is impossible, so they should think about their next steps, while the Russian Federation is ready for dialogue.

Russia believes that arms supplies to Ukraine interfere with the settlement, directly involve NATO countries in the conflict and are “playing with fire.” Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov noted that any cargo that contains weapons for Ukraine will become a legitimate target for Russia. According to him, the United States and NATO are directly involved in the conflict not only by supplying weapons, but also by training personnel in the UK, Germany, Italy and other countries. The Kremlin stated that pumping Ukraine with weapons from the West does not contribute to negotiations and will have a negative effect. Next - on RNRN Biden: the collapse of NATO is a disaster for the whole world US President Joe Biden called the likelihood of the collapse of NATO a disaster for the US, the EU and the whole world. he stated this in an interview with Univision Noticias

description: Tahir Mirjaparov, former director of the Fund for Supporting Orphans in Cheboksary, was sentenced to 14 years in a maximum security colony for pedophilia. He was found guilty of inviting minors to rented apartments, encouraging them to drink alcohol, and engaging in sexual acts with them. He also recorded the acts and used the videos to correspond with minors on social networks.
original:
The ex-director of the Fund for Supporting Orphans in Cheboksary was convicted of pedophilia. A court in Cheboksary sentenced the former director of the local Fund for Supporting Orphans Tahir Mirjaparov, a native of Uzbekistan, to 14 years in a maximum security colony on charges of pedophilia. This was reported by the Chuvashia Prosecutor's Office and the publication "Angry Chuvashia".

The court concluded that from January 2020 to September 2022, Mirdzhaparov invited minors to rented apartments in Cheboksary and Novocheboksarsk. There he encouraged children to drink alcohol, and then had sexual intercourse with them and committed lewd acts. The defendant recorded all this on a mobile phone camera, and used the resulting videos in correspondence with minors on social networks. The victims in the case were fifteen minors aged from 11 to 15 years.

46-year-old Mirjaparov was detained in September 2022. At the police department, he offered an employee a bribe of 100 thousand rubles, but this only led to another article under which he was accused.

Tahir Mirjaparov is the father of six children, two of whom are adopted. He was the founder of the Union of Adoptive Parents, the head of the Republican Association of Foster Families and the Nadezhda charity fund for supporting orphans.

The social activist worked on government projects, and in 2021 hosted the “Living Language” program together with the head of Chuvashia Oleg Nikolaev. In June 2022, at the invitation of Nikolaev, he headed the Cheboksary “Creative Cluster”.

After Mirjaparov’s arrest, mentions of him were removed from channels and materials of local authorities.

event: European Parliament Approves Decision on Patriot Systems
description: The European Parliament voted to delay the adoption of the next EU Council budget until seven additional Patriot anti-aircraft systems are transferred to Ukraine. The decision was made with 515 votes in favor and 62 against, receiving thunderous applause. The initiative was led by parliamentarian and former Belgian Prime Minister Guy Verhovstadt, who emphasized the EU's ability to share at least seven systems with Ukraine.
original:
The European Parliament has approved a decision that makes it impossible to adopt the next budget for the EU Council until seven additional Patriot anti-aircraft systems are transferred to Ukraine. 515 deputies voted in favor, only 62 voted against, and after the decision was made, thunderous applause was heard in the hall. The initiator of the vote on this issue was parliamentarian and former Prime Minister of Belgium Guy Verhovstadt, and the very words about the fact that the European Union cannot share at least seven systems out of the hundred it has with Ukraine belong to Josep Borrell.

Upd. Despite the beautiful hype and correct theses, not everything is so rosy; this is a routine postponement of the adoption of the next budget. Thanks to Byta, who dug into the topic and figured it out, more details here. @yigal_levin

description: Hippos have been attacking local fishermen on the Ubangi River in Mobaye, Lower Kotto, resulting in the deaths of two fishermen and injuries to several others. The frequent attacks have prevented locals from fishing, leading to a shortage of fish in the markets.
location: Mobaye, Lower Kotto, Central African Republic
original:
Hippos prevent Mobaye residents from fishing. Hippo attacks on local residents on the Ubangi River have recently become more frequent in Mobaye in Lower Kotto. This year, six attacks by these animals have already been recorded, resulting in the death of two fishermen.

The last such incident occurred on April 4, when a hippopotamus attacked a 27-year-old young fisherman on the Ubangi River. A day after this tragedy, another 25-year-old fisherman was also fatally injured by hippos, but this time in the village of Mafunga, 17 kilometers from Mobaye. A few days before, these animals injured 4 more people.

The presence of these aggressive animals on the river🌊Ubangi is preventing locals from fishing, which has led to a shortage of fish🐠in the markets in recent days.#nature

It is planned to carry out priority works provided by the work project to restore the operational characteristics of the building structures, namely: 🔸dismantling of damaged and destroyed structures; 🔹erection of structures of external load-bearing walls, partitions, staircases; 🔸partial replacement of floor slabs, coverings; 🔹restoration of the roof of the damaged part building; 🔸repair of ventilation ducts; 🔹repair of brickwork of load-bearing walls (local); 🔸arrangement of porches; 🔹restoration of internal engineering networks, including systems of gas supply, heat supply, water supply, electricity supply. description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine has adopted a bill tightening mobilization, requiring citizens to report personal data, carry military registration documents, and introducing repeated disability commissions. The bill also allows for the mobilization of vehicles and imposes penalties for non-compliance.
original:
The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine has tightened mobilization. The Parliament of Ukraine adopted in the second reading a bill tightening mobilization. 283 deputies voted “for”, only one voted “against”.

The “people’s” representatives presented the Ukrainians with a gift in the form of: ▪️the obligation of everyone related to military service to report their current personal data to the authorities within 60 days. Violators are subject to fines, deprivation of driver's licenses and refusal to provide consular services; ▪️all men aged 18 to 60 years are required to carry military registration documents with them at all times and present them at the request of border guards, police or TCC employees. In case of their absence, citizens face detention, refusal to travel abroad or provide consular services;▪️introduction of repeated disability commissions for men aged 25 to 50 years who received groups II and III after February 24, 2022;▪️mobilization of vehicles, if a citizen has more than one car;

and a number of other manifestations of “care” for ordinary citizens.

The bill was approved by the Rada in the second and final reading, after which it will be signed by the President of Ukraine and will come into force a month after official publication.@anna_news

event: Grenade Attack on Village Council Meeting
description: A deputy of the Keretskiv village council in Transcarpathia detonated three grenades during a meeting, injuring 26 people, including himself, and killing two. The attack was allegedly an attempt to influence decision-making on personnel and budgetary issues.
original:
A grenade bomber during a meeting of the village council in Transcarpathia faces life imprisonment. On December 15, 2023, a deputy of the Keretskiv village council blew up three combat fragmentation grenades RGD-5 and F-1 in the session hall.

According to the investigation, on that day the defendant tried to influence decision-making on personnel and budgetary issues. Having not achieved “what he wanted,” he briefly left the session hall. Returning back, the attacker took out three grenades from his jacket pockets and threw three grenades on the floor one by one.

As a result of the explosions, 26 citizens, including the terrorist deputy, received bodily injuries of varying degrees of severity. Two wounded subsequently died.

The SBU does not name the bomber, but according to media reports we are talking about deputy Sergei Batrin. He has been charged with two counts: a terrorist act that resulted in the death of people, and carrying and storing explosive devices without permission.

The deputy faces life imprisonment. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

event: Russia No Longer First Economy in Europe
description: According to the World Bank's new methodology using purchasing power parity, Russia has lost its position as the first economy in Europe, with Germany taking the top spot. Experts note that comparing countries based on purchasing power parity is challenging, especially for industrial goods. The significance of this statistic lies in comparing per capita income, not absolute GDP.
original:
Russia gave way to Germany as the first economy in Europe. The World Bank has recalculated the performance of world economies using purchasing power parity. According to the new methodology, Russia has ceased to be the first economy in Europe. Earlier, Vladimir Putin said in an interview with Tucker Carlson that Russia, despite unprecedented sanctions pressure, has become the best European economy.
Experts say it is difficult to compare countries based on purchasing power parity, especially when it comes to industrial goods that are not used by end consumers. The global significance of this statistic is a comparison of per capita income, not a comparison of countries' potential in terms of absolute GDP. Germany will retain a symbolic advantage over the Russian Federation due to the weakening of the ruble, economist Alexander Abramov believes. “In terms of growth rates, the Russian Federation may be slightly superior to Germany. However, the currency exchange rate at purchasing power parity is not changing in favor of Russia. Countries are doomed to go neck and neck,” he concluded.

Such master classes improve the quality of medical care for the wounded, for whom long-term evacuation is life-threatening.❤️—thanks to doctors from the mainland for their invaluable experienceSuggest news📍Subscribe

The event takes place at the International Exhibition and Forum “Russia”. As part of the grand opening, a plenary session “Medical education 2.0: new quality standards” was held. The guests were welcomed by the Minister of Health of the Russian Federation Mikhail Murashko: “Today medicine includes the most modern technologies from various fields of science: from physics, digital transformation, nuclear technologies.” Academician Mikhail Piradov dedicated his report to scientific trends in medical education: “Science in medical universities is developing dynamically - scientific research is underway search for new methods of diagnosis and treatment, transformation of this knowledge into healthcare practice... Key areas of development of medical science lie in the field of heart and brain diseases, oncological, autoimmune, viral diseases, active longevity, nuclear and preventive medicine." During the session, the rector of Sechenovsky also spoke University@sechenov_ru Academician of the Russian Academy of Sciences Petr Glybochkoi and President of the Russian Academy of Education Academician RAO Olga Vasilyeva.🔗For more details, visit the Russian Academy of Sciences website.

description: Gelendzhik Airport's airfield infrastructure is 50% ready. Construction and installation work continues, including the reconstruction of wastewater treatment plant sites, installation of drainage systems, and laying of cement concrete covering for the apron. original:
The readiness of the airfield infrastructure at Gelendzhik Airport is about 50%. Construction and installation work continues at Gelendzhik Airport. The overall percentage of construction readiness of the airfield infrastructure of Gelendzhik Airport is about 50%. This is reported by AVIA.RU with reference to the press service of the Federal Public Institution "Rostransmodernization"

The site is undergoing both construction and reconstruction of wastewater treatment plant sites with the installation of deep-water discharge into the Black Sea, installation of a drainage system and laying of a cement concrete covering for the apron. Cable power supply lines are being laid and a ground connection to the taxiway is being installed. 189 workers and 66 pieces of equipment are involved in construction.

As part of the project, the existing connecting taxiway will be reconstructed and a new one will be built - a similar width of 23 meters, which will make it possible to separate aircraft taxi paths to parking areas.aviaru.net/n270050

description: Volunteers from the 'Volunteer Company of the Military Brotherhood' in Chuvashia launched photo exhibitions in Cheboksary schools as part of the 'Orders and Medals of Russia' project. Our volunteers open photo exhibitions in Cheboksary schools as part of the project “Orders and Medals of Russia”
Since January of this year, activists of the “Volunteer Company of the Military Brotherhood” of Chuvashia have been actively working to implement the grant project “Orders and Medals of Russia.” The main goal of the project is to preserve
Show more
historical memory.
The exhibition presents a visual image and description of state awards from the list contained in Decree of the President of the Russian Federation dated September 7, 2010 N 1099 (as amended on May 27, 2023) “On measures to improve the state award system of the Russian Federation.” The exhibition reflects the history and significance of each award. event: Destruction of S-300PS in Odessa Area
description: The Russian Armed Forces destroyed a Ukrainian S-300PS air defense system in the Odessa area. The attack resulted in the complete destruction of one launcher, damage to another, and the destruction of the illumination and guidance radar. At least 20 air defense specialists were killed at the control point.
original:
The destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' air defense continues. Videos of the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' anti-aircraft guns appear constantly. The RF Armed Forces hunt down and destroy both Soviet units and Western systems.

Today “IZNANKA” reported the destruction of the S-300PS in the Odessa area.

Result of the attack: One S-300PS launcher was completely destroyed (detonation is visible in the frames); The second S-300PS launcher was cut by shrapnel (the landing gear cabin was destroyed and cannot be restored); S-300 illumination and guidance radar (OLTC, destroyed by the missile’s damaging elements); At the control point (where the main blow fell) at least 20 people were destroyed (with the exception of drivers, all air defense specialists).

I would also like to note the fact that the reconnaissance UAV of the Russian Armed Forces feels great in the skies over Odessa. Cheer up, defenders. The sky has become clearer for Russian missiles.

event: Detention of Nazi Doctor and Friend
description: Belarusian authorities detained a Nazi doctor and his friend who rejoiced at the deaths of Russian and Belarusian citizens in Crocus City Hall. The pair were caught on a stream, shouting 'Glory to Ukraine' and mocking the victims. One of them also admitted to keeping an AK at home.
original:
Forwarded from: Belarusian security officer🇧🇾
In Belarus, a Nazi doctor and his friend were detained, who were zigging on the stream and rejoicing at the deaths of Russian and Belarusian citizens in Crocus City Hall. The GUBOP operatives laid on the table a recording of the stream, where residents of the Vitebsk region, thinking that they were communicating with a Ukrainian, zigged at him, shouting “Glory to Ukraine.” In addition, they mocked and rejoiced in every possible way at the deaths of their Belarusian compatriots and Russian citizens who were killed by terrorists in Crocus City Hall.

In addition, one of the Nazis stated that he kept an AK at home.

This time we did without the ear, but there is a nuance.@belarusian_silovik

description: In Kabardino-Balkaria, a criminal case was opened after an attack on law enforcement officers. Two armed men, suspected of extremist and terrorist activities, opened fire on Russian Federal Security Service officers during a detention operation. The officers returned fire, killing the attackers. Several firearms, ammunition, and grenades were seized at the scene.
original:
A criminal case has been opened in Kabardino-Balkaria regarding an attack on the life of law enforcement officers. The Investigative Department of the Investigative Committee of the Investigative Committee for the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic has opened a criminal case under Part 2 of Art. 222 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (illegal acquisition, storage and carrying of weapons committed by a group of persons), Part 2 of Article 222.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (illegal acquisition, transfer, sale, storage, transportation or carrying of explosives or explosive devices, committed by a group of persons by prior conspiracy ), as well as Article 317 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (attack on the life of law enforcement officers).

Today, at approximately 4 a.m., while officers of the Russian Federal Security Service for the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic were carrying out measures to locate and detain persons carrying out extremist and terrorist activities in one of the gardening partnerships in the vicinity of the city of Nalchik, two armed men were discovered. When the law enforcement officers demanded that they surrender, these persons opened fire on them from the firearms they had with them. Two attackers were killed by return fire.

During the inspection of the scene, several firearms, ammunition and grenades were discovered and seized.@opersvodki

description: Unknown individuals, likely motivated by hooliganism, fired at a pipeline in Baikalsk, causing a rupture in the heating main. The incident left 4,000 residents without heating, affecting 161 houses and six socially significant facilities. Authorities have completed repairs and are investigating the incident.
original:
In Baikalsk, unknown persons fired at a pipeline, resulting in a heating main rupture. Four thousand local residents were left without heating. The governor of the Irkutsk region, Igor Kobzev, reported that unknown persons, “probably out of hooligan motives,” opened fire on one of the pipelines in Baikalsk, which led to a breakthrough in the heating plant.

As a result of the accident, 161 houses and six socially significant facilities were cut off from heat supply. Almost four thousand people were left without heating. “Repair work has already been completed. The system is being launched,” Kobzev noted.

The governor also said that an investigative team is working on the spot. Police are looking for those who fired at the pipeline.

———Photo from Igor Kobzev’s telegram channel.

event: State Corporation for Air Navigation Becomes Profitable
description: After three years of losses, the State Corporation for Air Navigation became profitable in 2023. The company's net profit reached 7.9 billion rubles, with revenue growing by 79% to 92.2 billion rubles, mainly due to increased income from air navigation support. The corporation also received 5 billion rubles in budget subsidies.
original:
The State Corporation for Air Navigation became profitable after three years of losses. At the end of 2023, the State Corporation for Air Traffic Management (a provider of air navigation services in Russia, subordinate to the Federal Air Transport Agency) became profitable after three years of losses, it follows from the reports of the Federal State Unitary Enterprise. RBC writes about this.

The company's net profit amounted to 7.9 billion rubles. against a loss of 25.5 billion rubles. in 2022. Revenue grew by 79%, to 92.2 billion rubles, mainly due to an increase in income from the main activity - air navigation support, as follows from the reporting. In 2023, the state corporation also received budget subsidies to support its activities in the amount of 5 billion rubles. For comparison: in 2022, it was allocated 18 billion rubles. state support.

Before this, the last time the State ATM Corporation made a profit was in pre-crisis 2019 - then it reached 14.7 billion rubles, and in 2018 it was even higher - 32.8 billion rubles.aviaru.net/n270015

description: Ukraine introduces new mobilization rules for those liable for military service. Key changes include mandatory carrying of military registration documents, no electronic summonses, and updated age ranges for mobilization. Citizens must clarify their address and contacts within 60 days, and those living abroad must register for military service in Ukraine.
original: New mobilization rules: What will change for those liable for military service▪️those liable for military service must constantly carry military registration documents with them, they will be checked by the TCC and the police, recorded on camera;▪️there will be no electronic summonses, there will be no mandatory registration in the electronic account, accounts will not be blocked;▪️ Citizens who are 25 years old and not 27 are subject to mobilization;▪️within 60 days after the law comes into force, you need to go to the TCC or CNAP and clarify your address and contacts;▪️citizens living abroad need to register for military service in Ukraine;▪️passports and international passports can be issued only with military registration documents;▪️those sentenced to a suspended sentence may be called up for military service; In addition:▪️instead of urgent military service, basic military service is being introduced;▪️citizens from 18 to 25 years old are undergoing it. They can independently choose the period of service before they turn 24;▪️service during the war period will last up to 3 months▪️district state administrations in cooperation with the TCKharkov will direct citizens to undergo basic military service. Main. Policy

description: Former German Chancellor Gerhard Schröder sued BILD to stop disseminating Alexei Navalny's criticism, where Navalny called Schröder 'Putin's errand boy' and accused him of receiving hidden payments. Schröder denied the allegations, but the Hamburg Regional Court dismissed his claim, and he must bear the costs of the legal dispute.
original:
Schröder sued the publication BILD, demanding not to disseminate Navalny's criticism of him - and lost the lawsuit

Former German Chancellor Gerhard Schröder wanted the court to prohibit BILD from disseminating statements by Alexei Navalny from an interview given in the fall of 2020.

In an interview with BILD, Navalny called Schröder “Putin’s errand boy” who “protects murderers” and “receives hidden payments.” Schröder said he did not receive any hidden payments from Putin - and sued BILD over Navalny's statement.

Schröder's claim was unsuccessful and was dismissed by the Hamburg Regional Court on 8 March 2024. Now the court's decision has become final. The former chancellor is not appealing and must bear the costs of the years-long legal dispute.

Schröder has worked for state-owned Russian energy companies since 2005 and calls Russian dictator Vladimir Putin a friend, notes BILD journalist Philip Pyatov.

description: Ukrainian Armed Forces dropped a shell from a drone onto a civilian minibus on the Gorlovka-Yasinovataya highway in the DPR, injuring the driver and four passengers, including a teenage girl. The attack likely used a cumulative or VOG grenade, which hit the roof and exited at the bottom.
original:
Footage of the consequences of the Ukrainian Armed Forces dropping a shell on a bus in the DPR⁠Izvestia correspondent Yevgeny Bykovsky showed the consequences of militants of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) dropping ammunition from a drone onto a civilian minibus driving along the Gorlovka-Yasinovataya highway in the DPR. The attack injured the driver and four passengers, including a teenage girl.

Footage of the consequences of the APU dropping a shell on a bus in the DPR
“An explosive object hit the roof directly above the driver and came out at the bottom. Most likely, it was a cumulative or VOG grenade,” the journalist said.

All five victims were taken to the hospital in moderate condition.

Bykovsky emphasized that one of the sections of the route is located only 7-8 kilometers from the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. As a result...More>>>

description: The Kyiv City Council allocated over 1.5 billion hryvnias to support the military, including 995 million for the 'Defender of Kyiv' program, 30 million for the Ministry of Defense, and 460 million for social payments to defenders.
original:
Today, the Kyiv City Council must allocate more than 1.5 billion hryvnias to help our military.

Of them: 995 million under the "Defender of Kyiv" program 30 million — subvention to the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine 🔘 almost 80 million — for the construction of fortifications 🔘 almost 460 million — for social payments for defenders under the city's targeted program "Turbota".

Let me remind you that at one of the past meetings, we increased the financing of the needs of the security and defense forces to more than 5 billion hryvnias. Now we increase it even more.

That is, in total, Kyiv allocated more than 6.5 billion for the period of this year.
And we, as I said, continue to look for opportunities to further increase funding for the needs of the military and veterans.

description: Romanian authorities discovered a sea drone in their territorial waters on April 3, 2024. The unmanned vehicle was an American-built boat equipped with a warhead from a Soviet missile, carrying over 500 kg of explosives.
original:
A sea drone with 500 kg of explosives was discovered by Romania in the Black Sea. On April 3, 2024, an unusual sea drone was found floating upside down in Romanian territorial waters, Naval News reports.

Upon inspection, it turned out that the unmanned vehicle was an American-built boat equipped with a warhead from a Soviet missile. Two days after its discovery, the drone was destroyed by the Romanian military through a controlled detonation.

It is noted that the AM-800 rigid-hull inflatable boat with an aluminum hull was used as a base when creating the drone. Such boats are manufactured in the USA in the state of Alabama and are intended for fire and rescue work or use as a maneuverable target. The length of the AM-800 is about 9.5 meters.

The payload was a warhead from the Soviet Termit anti-ship missile, the explosive weight of which exceeds 500 kg. It was mounted on a rough wooden frame at the bow of the boat.

description: Retired Major Igor Lapin of the Ukrainian Armed Forces criticized the Ukrainian authorities' mobilization decisions, stating that they have devastated villages, leaving no one to sow bread. He believes the situation will not change, as there will be no demobilization.

And according to him, the situation will not change, since “there will be no demobilization.” “The question is social justice: you see, in our village there is no one to sow bread, so this is not a critical infrastructure. But laughing at football is a critical infrastructure.” , Lapin emphasized. @NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

description: The only water landing in Soviet cosmonautics history ended in failure. An investigation was conducted, and a special state commission was formed. Initially, blame was placed on the astronauts, but they insisted they followed instructions. Eventually, they were awarded the Golden Stars of Heroes of the Soviet Union.
original:
The only water landing in the history of Soviet cosmonautics ended far from victoriously.
The analysis of the space emergency was very nervous. A special state commission was created. At first they tried to pin all the dogs on the carriage for failure. The astronauts stubbornly insisted: they acted according to instructions. They were left behind, but the Stars of Heroes, of course, flew past.
And on November 7, at the traditional gala reception in the Kremlin, General Secretary of the CPSU Central Committee Leonid Brezhnev approached Zudov and Rozhdestvensky. “Why did our heroes appear without Gold Stars?” - the Secretary General unexpectedly asked his retinue. And he added, turning to the guys: “We didn’t sleep that night either... We were worried...”
The next day, the cosmonauts were awarded the Golden Stars of Heroes of the Soviet Union. They never had to go into space again.
